title: Tanot Mata Temple Visit & India Pak Border visit
review: It’s roughly around 160 km from Jaisalmer and a very famous temple near the border. The temple has very famous history about shelling around the temple and not even single shell exploded near the Mata Temple. A place to be visited and off course India Pak Border Visit for which you must have a permission to go near the border otherwise you will not be able to go there.

title: Temple at the border
review: This is the temple had no damage during the 1965 war even after getting lots of attacks in the compound. This is managed by BSF considering auspicious for them. Good to visit if you have time and visiting Longewala.

title: Must visit for those who have a passion for Indian Army.
review: Tanot Mandir is situated around 130 kms from Jaisalmer. Usually a cab is charged at INR 3500 from Jaisalmer. The importance of Tanot Mandir is that, during India-Pakistan war in 1971, Pak dropped 3000 bombs on the Indian side out of which 450 bombs were dropped near Tanot Mandir, and none of the bomb got exploded. The Indian army has maintained the site now.

title: Temple
review: A very beautiful and nice place to visit. The rituals followed here are worth visiting and the best time to visit is in morning

title: Goddess who protects the Indian Army
review: Temple very well maintained by the BSF. The temple complex has all the facilities that a traveller would need. There are no proper eateries in this place. While visiting this place pleae carry packed food.

title: A little overrated
review: Although they say the evening aarti performed by army jawans is mesmerizing, at other times - not so much. I remember it most for the free roaming goats who have their eyes on the sweet prasad and the mystical area where people tied handkerchiefs. But nothing awe-worthy

title: Faith & Divininty
review: if you visit longewala  take time & visit the Tanot Mata Temple its a 20 mint drive from longewala, this temple dedicated to Tanot Mata is also visisted by Army soilders who have grast fatih that the mata protects them, the soilders  hold a Arti everyday

title: Temple with faith of Army
review: The temple is situated 120 kms from Jaiselmer and take 2 hours by car to reach there . The way is through desert and very less populated. The Border is very close from this temple. The temple is very well maintained by Indian Army . People say that during war it didn’t get damage even after heavy bombardment from Pakistan. The goddess saved the villagers.

title: Jai Mata Ki
review: The temple which survived 400+ shells and an assault by a whole tank regiment of enemy!

title: Tanot + Border post
review: A visit to this place is incomplete without visiting the Indo-Pak border. Do take permission from the BSF office in the Jaisalmer city beforehand.

title: Beautiful temple close to the border
review: Witnessed a troop of soldiers offering their prayers at this place before going for some combat happening at some place closeby.

title: Must visit temple
review: We visited this place during our visit to Jaisalmer. It is must visit to this place when you are in Jaisalmer. History of the temple is well known and it pushed us to visit it.

title: Felt blessed
review: After watching border movie and visiting longewala memorial it's must to see Temple. You feel blessed and proud to see BSF taking care and maintaining the decorum of the place. You can also see the bombs which fell their during war but didnt explode.

title: Nearest to Pakistan border
review: Apart from religious the main attraction of this temple is that if you want to see the indopak border the you have to go visit this temple.Here a bsf office is there where you will find whether you can go to border or not but remember  you have to apply for permission at Jaisalmer office only.

title: Temple in Deep Desert
review: This temple is maintained by BSF and is neat and clean. From here one can proceed to Indo-Pak Border with prior permission of authorities. Road to temple is excellent  and at one location reminds of Leh Ladakh without snow clad peaks.

title: Incredible Ride to Tanot
review: The ride from Jaisalmer city to tanot is very beautiful. it will stay with you days after you will take one.

title: New year prayers
review: It is a beautiful Temple of mata tanotrai the bombs thrown here during the indo-pak war  are still kept there in exhibition

title: Amazing
review: Amazing beautiful. Just go and also go see the boarder . Amazing feeling and makes you feel proud of being an Indian .

title: very nice temple and a must visit place during your trip to jaisalmer.
review: neat n clean temple with all the war photos displayed .Right on the border of Longewala post at the border of India/Pak.

title: Religious Tour
review: It gives a very pious and peaceful feeling while you are there. It is very well maintained by the BSF.  Be careful of the goats which roam around and inside the temple. Do not feed them inside the temple.

title: Still blessing us
review: It was tanot mata who saved us from enemy in 1971. There is a temple in tanot who was said to be bombarded heavily but to everyone’s surprise no bomb set off. Still bombs are placed there for the visitors to see. It is a rare miracle if everthing said about the place is right.

title: Visit to Tannot
review: We visited this on the insistence of our driver. This place is near Pakistan border & people here think this temple as important as Vaishnodevi. This was attacked by Pak army in 1965 war but survived without any damage. Now this is maintained by BSF & quite orderly can have the darshan.

title: Godly Place managed by BSF
review: had a long talk with Panditji, who himself is in BSF. He narrated everything about the temple and about himself.

title: Spiritual and Patriotic.
review: I'm not a personal for temples. We had visited the Longewala Border ( Indo -Pak 1971 war location). And then we came here. Its a good 20-30 Kilometre drive. The soldiers and BSF Jawans do the aarti here. I am not a person for temples, but I sat through this due to the sheer respect for the Jawans, their dedication to this nation and sacrifice, the energy and reverberation created due to their energetic, enthusiastic performance. It's exhilarating and spiritual. You can't help but sit because of them. It also houses some artifcats and bomb shells from the war, shells that fell around this very temple during the war but still failed to even as much as scrath the temple! That is the power of this place. If you're into " Mannats" you should certainly come here, and tie a handkerchief for whatever that you seek. I'm sure it'll come through, teh army people diligently believe in it.

title: Nice place
review: The place is located 130 kms from Jaisalmer and 35 kms from Longewala. The mortar and bombs hurled at the temple by the enemy pakistan did not explode there during the 1965 war with pakistan. It is maintained and highly revered by the BSF. The BSF believes that the Tanot Mata helps them during the war.

title: Interesting story !!
review: Legendary story behind the temple .else nothing great about the architecture or the place .mainly a stopover for visiting pak border closely

title: Legendary
review: Maintained by BSF. Clean, no haggling by pundits. Like an oasis. God sent protection to soldiers. Boosts morale of troops.

title: Tanot mata Mandir :A blend of Bravoury and belief
review: A blend of Bravoury and belief , A place where 3000 bombs were thrown by enemies but could not broke the sacred place.  A unique experience of A temple comletely taken care by BSF .  A superb car drive experience from sam sand dunes to tanot  ....If you are going for night stay in tents  at sand dunes and planning for Tanot then after your checkout from tent in the morning there is a direct road to Tanot from Sam resort  area , u need not to go to jaisalmer back .  A novel experience of border visit is possible from Tanot mata  Mandir , BSF allows visitor to take close look of IND Pak Border , (Fence gate no 609). For that one  need to apply a day before visit at BSF head quater gate near badabagh in Jaisalmer. Photo copy of ID proof of all visitor ( including driver)and vehicle information . Don't forget to take lunch at Highway, Hotel Hingalaj in Ramgadh on the way to Tanot.

title: Beautiful temple and well maintained
review: It's a beautiful temple and well maintained by the Army people. It has lunch facility as well and serves really good food. Little far from the city, but worth a visit and shows what prayers and belief can do!!

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: The Tanot Mata Temple is about 3 hrs drive from Jaisalmer. The temple is maintained by the Boder Security Force and is revered by them as it was unharmed during the Indo Pak war of 1971 when not a single shell fired by the enemy exploded near the temple. A must visit place for anyone coming to Jaisalmer.

title: Superb management
review: Good to see BSF people managing the entire temple .Worth visiting the place when in town.Not very far from Jaiselmer.

title: The miracle - unquestionable !
review: Over 1400 bombshells couldn't tough this sacred temple of Tanot which is right at the Border (LOC). The temple now has been extended and made more spiritual tourism-centric. A Must visit and try not to miss the Aarti !!!

title: A must visit place in Jaislmer if you have time
review: This is located around 120Kms from Jaislmer, And the mobile networks don’t work here. I had visited tanot mata mandir which was a very unique experience. The mata temple has a charm of its own and travelers can enjoy beautiful sand dunes scenes on the way to mata temple.

title: Fulfilling your desert odyssey
review: It was end of October and  I had driven through the desert with my hatch back.They journey was awesome as the rood is extremely well maintained.The temple was managed by BSF people and they actually polite to tourist.

title: Temple with boarder visit - worth the distance!
review: We decided to visit Tanot mata temple and boarder, which is about 250 kms extra trip from Sandune area. But you get a feel of desert and it’s life’s associated with desert. You find camel, cow, goat, ship and saw deer occasionally. Hardly u will see tree throughout the way except occasional neam tree or some tree around the only canal area. Temple is maintained by Indian army and very clean. The history goes to 1965 war with Pak when the bomb never exploded here. Then we took permission and visited boarder. It’s lifetime experience to meet the BSF women guarding the boarder. Also we realized how fortunate we are after visiting thru Jaisalmer desert areas.

title: Indo-Pak Border
review: Get permission the previous day from BSF Office located in Jaisalmer city near Hanuman Circle. You have to enter the visitor details, registration number of vehicle you are travelling, photocopy of IDs of all visitors, in the registration form. You will be submitting this in the first day. The application after approval will be sent to the BSF office, located infront of the Tanot Mata Temple, around 3-4 pm in the same day. It is better to finish the job in the first day itself. You can directly go the temple, the next day and collect the entry ID from the BSF Office, by submitting the original ID of yourself. You have to show the ID given by BSF, in two check posts, on the way to border. Two wheelers are also allowed to visit Tanot Mata Temple and Indo-Pak Border. Temple is 120 km away from Jaisalmer city. Border is further 15 km away from Temple. You can hire two wheelers/four wheelers. Even they will help in locating the BSF Office in the city to fill the form.

title: Majestic experience
review: Very calming and non commercial temple in today's time . Thanks to BSF who manages it.

title: Absolutely Spiritual
review: Here, during IndoPak war in 1965, Pak army fired 450 bombs in temple premises. None of them did any damage to the temple. A place of worship for Jawans and also for the villages in this area. Temple is looked after by BSF.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: We booked luxurious bus, but the bus was an average bus. The temple seen was a good temple, but is managed by Seema Surakasha Bal operatives. It is not properly managed, as the Arti is scheduled at 7:00 pm-7:30 pm, but public is not allowed to have a darshan from 6:00 pm itself, not valuing visitors time and they have to wait till arti.

title: Best ARTI i have ever seen
review: It is said that during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965, Pakistani Army dropped over 3000 bombs targeting the temple but not even one exploded! The Pakistani Tank regiment was stupefied and kept shelling but not one bomb exploded. After the war the Pakistani General actually asked his counterpart in India about this incident and on knowing the story of the power of the temple that apparently protected the area he asked to see this place. This request was granted and the Pakistani General actually went to the temple and paid his respects and acknowledged the supernatural happening. After the war the temple management was handed over to Border Security Force of India on their request and to date the temple is maintained and manned by the BSF soldiers.

title: Very Nice place to seehow our Jawans are running the temple.
review: Visit this temple along with Longewala. The temple is managed by BSF. This will be a day trip from Jaisalmer.

title: A temple maintained by BSF
review: This temple has historical importance aa the mortars and bombs targeted at this place in 1971 remained unexploded due to supernatural powers and mataji blessings.It also has a victory pillar.

title: Faith Restored
review: A must visit place, Tanot Mata temple is 135 kms from Jaisalmer and 35 kms from Longewala War Memorial. The temple has a lot of reverence in Jaisalmer - during 1971 war, thousands of bombs were dropped at the temple, however, magically not one exploded inside the temple complex (while all other bombs/artillery from Pakistan army exploded everywhere else). Specimens of live un-exploded bombs are still at display in the temple. Tourists can also visit the actual border from here, but prior permissions need to be taken from BSF camp at Jaisalmer.

title: Spectacular display of belief
review: Spectacular display of belief ,so many bombs dropped by pakistani air force but none of them exploded,its miracle ,It also give great moral boostup for our army as trhey feel they are safe till this temple is there.

title: nice temple
review: the temple which is maintained by BSF. it is approx 120 km from jaisalmer. Visiting this temple is also an opportunity to visit the Thar Desert

title: One of the most powerful deity based on the Darshan experience
review: Legend says that more than 200 bombs were dropped in and around the temple which did not explode and the temple of the mata remained intact for this story to be narrated.

title: Great place
review: Nice temple...neat and clean place....

title: jai mata di
review: spell bound to see the unexploded shell inside the temple. felt the presence of strong force in the temple and surroundings

title: great temple
review: the place ids one of the finest that the jaisal,er town can provide. on emust visit the temple even though it is a little faraway.

title: Navratri celebrations
review: Celebrated Durga Ashtami in resonating atmosphere devoted to Maa Durga on special Aarti by the priests. Indeed a strong spiritual moment with true and vibrant colours of Rajasthan

title: The temple has a mystery attached to it!
review: Apparently, bombs from the Indo-Pak war of 1971 lie diffused here when they were thrown by the enemy part into the temple premises. Such is the power of the local ruling goddess, they say. The temple still displays the bombs with great pride and honor.

title: Jai Mata Di
review: its a temple where the pak had used force guns to bend it down during the war and nothing has happend to it still you can see the armoury things inside the temple. One should definately visit this place and take the blessings of the Goddess here.

title: MIRACLE TEMPLE
review: Very peaceful and calm temple managed by BSF.

title: Historical place.. must visit
review: We really astonished some of the some fact about this place... From here we left for border .. Excellent place to watch our soldier how they are staying irrespective of weather condition... Extraordinary effort by ordinary person....

title: Visit of Jaisalmer
review: You have one more day in Jaisalmer must visit this place. See our army museum. Temple managed by army official.

title: Serene place maintained by BSF
review: The route from Jaisalmer to Tanot mata has lot of picturesque places. The temple is built in a serene place and the pujari is a BSF jawan himself.

title: Tanot Mata Mandir
review: We all usually recognize the temple as it's the same shown in Border Bollywood movie. Very famous temple in the region and quite popular for tourist after watching movie Border.

title: Excellent mandir
review: The temple of tanot mata is managed and maintained by the crpf or BSF jawaan. This place is very famous and beautiful and silent. Do maintain the same.

title: Vast temple
review: Managed by Army, this is the temple which shows the miracles of Tanot mataji

title: Jai Mata Di
review: A must pace to visit.  Excellent structure with  pictures and decorations made us to visit onceagain at the appropriate time.

title: religious place
review: This temple is somewhat 120 kms from city and if one is travelling for shorter duration it is difficult to visit there though visit offers spectacular drive in desert areas, barren lands, a good road (thanks to BRO for well maintaining the lesser traveled road) and very little human habitation, no mobile network, lesser food joints and stopovers. Journey to longewala battle field and tanot temple should be combined and takes around 6-8 hours, so  one can plan accordingly.

title: Temple close to the Rajasthan Pakistan border
review: quaint little temple nestled away close to rajasthan jaisalmer and pakistan border. takes about 2 hours from jaisalmer. make sure you try to get permission from bsf at jaisalmer if you want to visit the border.

title: Tanot mata mandir
review: Approx 120 km from jaisalmer..  true feeling of desert come driving towards temple..... bsf post near temple.

title: Temple
review: This temple is maintained by BSF VERY CLEAN. Has old bombs droped by Pakistan. Very near to Pakistan boarder

title: Interesting History and beautiful geography comes together
review: Its about 2hrs driving from the Jaisalmer Fort. Enroute you find beautiful large sand dunes and colorful village huts. The temple is now managed by Border Security Force and is associated with the history of Indo Pak War (on which the movie Border is based). This temple and its deity are believed to protect its people and the Indian army, and you can still see the unexploded shells that have been preserved as the symbols of that protection.

title: gods home
review: should go here, it will give a feeling of blessed and calmness , way to reach has very good views of desert

title: JAI MATA KI
review: Jai Tanot mata, Saved our post during India Pak 1971 war, Pak dropped hundreads bomb on temple but due to Mata Tanot not a single bomb blast happened

title: Awesome
review: Speciality of this place : it is historic temple of Tanot mata, people of all religion come here to worship and fulfill wishes, during war with pakistan many bombs were fired in and around temple, the bombs which fell inside premises never exploded a kind of super natural power exists here is what local says.

title: Road to temple is awsome
review: About 2 hours ride form jaisalmer city.Road is full of desert. Temple has story that no bomb fired by Pakistan could destroy the temple even some of them couldn't make blast. These bombs are kept in temple for display. Temple maintained by border security force of India.

title: The Goddess worshipped during the Indo Pak war!
review: Now, most of the temples have their religious importance however, this wonderful place has its own Patriotic importance!

title: Must Visit Place
review: I went to Tanot Mata Temple. Localities have immense faith on the temple’s austerity and pay regular visit to the Tanot Mata. She is believed to be an apparition of the Hinglaj Mata Goddess. It is great place to go.

title: Tanot Mata - Supreme Power
review: A must visit holy temple for people travelling around Jaisalmer city.The temple is maintained & built by Indian Army.The temple has divine power & people all across come to this temple to pray.Best time to visit this temple is in winters as temperature are high during summers

title: A must visit place
review: We visited Tanot Mata temple along with Longewala War Memorial. The temple is neatly maintained by BSF.

title: Nothing much to visit except a temple
review: The location is about 20 km from Laungewala war memorial. Its a simple temple just like others but has some bombs preserved which were used in 1971 war and didn't explode.

title: Divine place
review: Must visit on trip to Jaisalmer. Aarti in morning and evening is done by BSF soldiers and is too good.

title: Beautiful
review: Very nice tample to visit. Historical place to c and feelings comes as solders... Bit far but truly sence to visit this as longe wala war at 1965 and 1971 with Pakistan... We won.... War museum.... Unforgettable...... Thanks

title: Trip to Jaisalmer/Longewala Post/Tanot village - one of the most memorable trip
review: I personally feel that Jaisalmer trip is not complete  if you have not visited Longewala post and Tanot village.

title: Patriotic feeling inside a temple
review: This is quite outskirts of Jaisalmer and you will need  to travel1.5 to 2 hrs from the town to reach here.  One long journey passing through barren lands on both sides  with just a occasional glimpse of human existence (children grazing goats or remote houses). Best hire a car along driver to drive you there. The temple is managed by the BSF including cleaning and conducting of worship (Pooja &Prasadam)You will find lots of goats/ rams roaming freely in the temple premises troubling tourists for food. They act very rowdy and can be frightening since they are built well eating the freely available food.  I understood these were gifted to the temple for slaying purpose but BSF people are now taking care of them. We tried clicking snaps with the soldiers with a feeling of pride in our hearts but they were quite reluctant to pose. There is no mobile network coverage in this area as well as no public telephone booths around. You can cover the Tanot Mata temple – Longewala post – Kuldhara- Sam Sand Dunesin this one trip to outskirts of Jaisalmer.

title: Unbelievable history, do visit it..
review: Since other reviews cover the history of this temple, I would just highlight my experience that the temple opens at least after 11am on every Friday (as per army people there), since they do the cleaning of temple every Friday morning. I don't know why it takes till 11am to clean it from inside, especially when army people are maintaining this place. Anyway, in our case, the temple opened around 11:45am, and there were lot of people gathered outside already by then. There were hardly any army people maintaining the people's queues outside and inside the temple, so we had to again make our way through to go inside do the 'darshan'. This delay also made us skip some other plans in the Jaisalmer, so if you are planning for temple visit on Friday, do keep above point in mind.

title: Visit to enjoy the drive through desert.
review: Average temple that also contains a muslim majar with in the complex. May visit to enjoy drive through arid thar

title: Tanot Mata Mandir place of peace and Bravity
review: It is amust visit if you are in jaisalmer and combine with visit to longewala war memorial. you can see the pakistani bombs which never went off. We go there directly from Sum (take turn before Jaisalmer). This is the only temple maintained by BSF. Local hotel is also there. Probably only option for lunch but with good taste.

title: Nostalgic
review: the temple indeed is historic in itself it offered protection to jawans during the war against pakistan and none of the shells exploded within a particular area, after that this temple was found. BSF takes care of the temple, now its beautified the whole complex is renovated. You must attend the evening aarti its amazing and specially during navratre, its 121km away from Jaisalmer and a cab takes 2000-2500INR to go there. If you plan for jaisalmer please go and visit Tanot Mata Temple.

title: Proof that higher power exists
review: In the war over 3000 mortar shells fell out of which 1400 fell on tanot. The power of the goddesses of the temple not a single shell exploded. It’s is true and those army men lived to tell the tale. Tanot temple is taken care of by the bsf since then. Jai mata di

title: Fantastic temple taken care by indian army
review: Fantastic temple and must visit place. Live bombs which were not blast during Indo Pak war due to blessings of Mataji. Whole place is governed by Indian army. Really nice place.

title: Amazing road from Longewala to Tanot Mata
review: After you visit Longewala border, the road to Tanot Mata temple is amazing. It's a must ride place for motorcyclists. Tanot temple is operated by BSF and is a modern looking temple nowadays. You can also see photographs of celebrities who have visited the temple and a few bomb shells that were thrown by Pakistan and believed to be diffused as soon as they fell in the temple's vicinity.

title: Good
review: Heard about this temple a lot and is considered to be one of the must places to visit while in Jaisalmer as this temple is managed by BSF .. The only challenges I can see that people were trying to take selfies while worshiping which should be banned as this was creating lot of problems to the other persons

title: Temple with a Tale - must visit !!
review: We visited this place in Dec 2017.

title: Serene place
review: A beautiful place to visit -35Kms from longewala check post of Indo-Pak border.

title: Truely Miracle
review: I am not first to review the place but after having familiar with the history nothing than miracle by Tanot Mata who protected the site.But someone want to visit Bharat-Pak border must take permission from Jaisalmer which we were missed so unable to see border,infact border is not tourist place one has to keep in mind.

title: worth a visit only if one visits the Indo-Pak border too
review: although highly revered but there is nothing much in the temple as such for a 2 hour journey from jaisalmer

title: High energy zone
review: Tanot mataji mandir is rich in positive energy, you will feel that once there. BSF maintains the temple well. Around 150 kms from Jaisalmer.

title: Story you will love
review: Jai Mata Di, The story here is fascinating & you will love to feel that, Limited armors to be seen but you feel the vibe.

title: Amazing place, Wonderful mata aarti
review: This is a place of ambience. A historical place related to 1965 war. The temple has huge campus managed by Indian armed force -BSF. The Arti is being  done by a dozen soldier with a great show of musical instruments. I loved it. Evening arti time is 6pm which gets completed in around 70 minutes. If you go by public transportation, there are less chances to get any bus. So you should be ready to stay at the Temple lodging.

title: Temple with Goddess's blessings on India
review: It is ofcourse like any temples in India but it's famous for the stories during the war where 3000 bombs were lying and none of it blasted. They are still painted and kept inside the temple. Many people come here to take blessings of the temple. It is currently being managed by BASF.

title: Very historical Temple on the Boarders
review: This temple has been a historical place mainly due to the war when the whole surrounding was destroyed by the bombing of Pakistani army, however not even one could destroy the temple. This is a very history temple for the country and mostly for the Indian Army.

title: The Facination of History
review: All the bomb fired by Pakistani Army in this temple compound couldn't expload. A landmark of Indian War History. Good destination for religious people. Don't for forget to see the bomb (kept inside the temple). Beware of the got roaming around.

title: Peace and Bravity
review: This Temple was build by the army officers and during the war indo pakistan in 1965 few live bombs where dropped at this place but they never exploded. you can also have a click pictures and see the missles and ready the history kept in the showcase.

title: A temple close to the Rajasthan Pakistan border
review: The Tanot Mata temple is about a 2 hour ride from Jaisalmer.The ride is one of the best parts...excellent roads with just desert sand dotted with shrubs on both sides of the road.The temple is maintained by the BSF.The deity is considered to be very powerful and protective.In the 1971 war not a single enemy shell exploded in and around the temple.Some are exhibited within the temple premises.Indian tourists may visit the border which is 20 km away...prior permission is required.This can be obtained only in Jaisalmer.A point to note is that after Ramgarh (which is about an hour or so before)only BSNL mobiles work.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: This temple is about 145 km from Jaisalmer City but must be visit. The campus of this temple managed by BSF. Bombs of war of 1965 (Bharat-Pakistan) which were thrown by the Pakistani Army, are still there which were not exploded at that time. If want to see the border, get the advance permission from the Jaisalmer City as the border is only at the distance of 23 km from here. On the way, enjoy the real desert. There are many goats in this compound.

title: Must see - The road journey itself offers a unique experience
review: I would say if one is going to Jaisalmer, then this place should not be missed. The best part is the journey itself, which offers stunning views of remote landscape with desert vegetation and completely devoid of habitations. The road is good and clear with no traffic. It can be easily reached under 2 hours despite 120 km distance to be covered. The cab journey is expensive which could be a factor for consideration specially for budget travellers. Cost is sole deterrent which may hold back tourists from visiting this place, otherwise must be visited and experienced.

title: How is this even possible ?
review: History of the place make you ask the scientific question - how is this possible but then somethings are best left unanswered and just soak it all in.

title: Extremely Far, has war significance
review: Try to take a bus to visit this place, as cabs will charge you a bomb to get here, it will take around 3hrs from the city.. talking about bombs, few bombs that were dropped here by enemies did not explode..The Temple itself is not attractive as such..you can book a stay here too for a very cheap price..

title: Nice Holy Place
review: The place is religious and has a place in history of Indian military. The live bombs were nice to see.

title: Omni-powerful Goddess
review: During the Indo-Pak War of 1971, Pakistani troops shelled The Holy Temple. But not one shell landed close to the Holy Temple and damaged.

title: Definitely Recommended
review: This temple withstood unharmed while war of India Pakistan. Where bombs hurled towards it till date are live & didn't explode.

title: Jai Mata Di
review: Old and Famous Temple from ancient times. But got More international fame when in 1965 war , 450 from 2000'ss Pakistani Air bombs didn't worked around this place. One of the Battling ground for 1965 war. Way from here leads to Border  line and then back to Sadewala Post-take Permission from Jaiselmer before you reach here if you want to go Main Border.15 Km west.

title: Jai mata di ! wonder temple maintained by BSF
review: must visit if you are in jaisalmer and combine with visit to longewala war memorial. you can see the pakistani bombs which never went off.

title: Worth visiting
review: It is around 120 kms away from jaisalmer city

title: Jai mata di
review: We visited Tanot temple for the second time. I would love to come here again & again. First of all its a religious place however apart from that the journey from jaisalmer to Tanot temple is so beautiful that you u would end up stopping at least 4-5 times in between for photos and videos.

title: A must visit ! maintained by Military
review: This holy place has an interesting story and a shocking sight where you see an Islamic structure built within the hindu premise. Very strange and unique. A long drive from the main city. Its very close to the Pakistan border.

title: Quick visit
review: This place is usually crowded being a religious place. I visited this place to especially see the shells which were untouched during the 1971 war. A quick 10 minute visit is good enough. The army canteen there serves tasty samosa's if you want a quick bite and that too really cheap. The best route to get there is from longewala, good roads & smooth roads. Between Rajasthan roads will never disappoint you

title: Jai mata ki

A true icon for the BSF and the Armed forces here who have built up her shrine which now also houses the museum containing all the unexploded bombs from the 1971 war. A must-see place which kids and adults enjoyvery much.

review: best temple we have visited .totally managed by army and people told us the stories of india pak war time . must see

review: After your visit the the temple.  You are so releived with the calmness surrounded by it.  Under defence control.  After visiting the temple or on the site, we could just visualize Sunil Shetty in the temple in the Border Movie.The temple premises are neatly maintained by the army.  Do not forget to read the plagues put within and outside the temple.  You feel proud to visit this place and click snaps near Vijay Stamb erected after the great war of Longewalla

title: right near border
review: A very famous temple during the 1971 war located very close to border with Pakistan.

title: Tanot mata mandir
review: It is the place on which  Pakistan fired 450 bombs and no one from all blast here, it was  only due to the power of Mata Tanot Devi. Now a days BSF taking all care of this holy place. You can see some of the live bombs   which were out of that 450 un blast bombs.

title: Not only destination but you will love the road while travelling to Tanot Mata Temple
review: It is a small temple in tanot village very close to India Pakistan border. The road from Jaisalmer to Tanot was very good. And if you want to explore real Rajasthan i.e. Thar Desert then this is your destination. You can also visit Longewala to see war memorial where you will see captured tanks and vehicles from Pakistan Army.

title: Godess who resisted missiles
review: Tanot Mata is the shrine where none of the missiles got activated when Pakistan dropped them. It is a miracle of the goddess to have resisted the attacks and now the BSF takes care of the shrine. It is believed that the goddess is protecting our Western frontier. People who does not believe in God must visit and they will feel the presence of the god.

title: Nice temple
review: This is nice temple. Ind-Pak border is hardly 10 km away from this temple.

title: Great divine place
review: Jai Mata Ki,

title: great drive through Thar
review: It's 121 km from Jaisalmer. the best part is the journey, we were on motorcycle, you drive through vast expanse of Thar. The sand dunes are much better than what you find in Sam. The route passes through Ramgarh town, small desert Dhanis(village) before you reach the temple. On the way you can stop by Gantiayli Mata temple. Even if you are not a devotee the journey is worth with undulating desert landscape. The roads  is managed by BRO and area and temple by BSF. If you want to visit Pakistan border better take permission for Jaisalmer before starting. there is a small canteen which serves tea and snacks.

title: Visit if you are religious
review: Its actually a small temple with a thrilling history...nothing much to see, only strengthens one's belief. The drive to the temple takes anywhere between 1.5-2 hrs and terrain keeps you intrigued. Another attraction is to see the border but one rarely gets permission these days.

title: Tanot Mata
review: It is a miracle to witness. Checked out the bombs that never went off. Do not try to disturb the Goats roaming around :) they can hit you as I witnessed a child getting hurt.

title: Amazing drive to the temple watching sand dunes
review: The drive to Tanot mata temple gives us the real experience of sand dunes. Kids enjoyed going up and coming down the sand dunes Excellent road maintained by the Indian army. Peaceful temple but doesnt have good restaurants closeby for lunch.

title: Temple maintained by BSF
review: Tanot Mata Temple is located near India Pakistan border. The temple is maintained by BSF. You can see live bombs and rockets which is fired by Pakistan army in the war but did not blast.  You can see sand dunes on the way to the temple. Temple is about 125 kms. from Jaisalmer.Longewala post is near by ,roads are excellent.

title: Jai mata di
review: Jai mata di unbelievable  filing  must be go there nice filing big desert  is that 120 k.m. from jaisalmer city  &120 full desert safari  must go

title: A divine power near Indo-Pak boarder in Tanot
review: The temple is located in Tanot village in Jaisalmer near India-Pakistan boarder and maintained by BSF This temple has a divine power as none of the bombs exploded fired by Pakistani Army during the 1965 war targeted to the temple. Some of the bomb are kept in the temple for display purpose. Moreover, the view of sand dune between Ramgarh to Tanot Mata make the visit of temple more attractive. A must visit place during Jaisalmer trip.

title: near border
review: tanot mata teample is near border on rout will be find true manifiacant dunes but little far from city

title: Divine Power
review: This temple is located at the Tanot village of Jaisalmer which is just a few kms away from the Indo-Pak border. This temple became famous during the 1965 and 1971 Indo-Pak War. The Pakistan Army had fired around 3000 missiles during the 1965 war targeting the temple but none of them exploded.Again around 4 missiles landed near the Tanot temple in the 71 war but the results were just the same.This scene has been depicted in the famous Bollywood movie "Border".Thus a divine, supernatural intervention saved our brave soldiers.The temple apart from housing the deity also serves as a museum which has the replicas of the shells that were fired, on display as well as pictures of various dignitaries who have visited this place.The temple complex is entirely maintained by the Border Security Force(BSF).The temple complex has washroom facilities as well as a souvenir shop.. It is at a distance of 120 km (2-3 hours drive) from Jaisalmer. The road leading to the temple is smooth and safe since it is maintained by BSF. This temple is a must visit during a trip to Jaisalmer.

title: The Protector
review: You will get to see over size goats! Maintained by Army! Wanted to visit because of it's history. Longewala and Tanot Mata temple fall around the same area!  Need a day to cover this side of a place!

title: Great Place - Must Visit
review: We hired a bike from Jaisalmer to visit Tanot Mata temple. There were two reason to visit this place. One, the legend attached to this temple and second the journey. I must say, it was great. On the way as soon as you would cross Ramgarh, the actual desert would start. You can see sand dunes all around and some clean sand dunes on the way. We saw a few deer as well crossing the road. The temple is maintained by BSF and all the basic facilities were provided there by them. Let me tell you its very very difficult to get anything in that desert. Its a beautiful place and has its own significance in the history.

title: Visit of you plan for Longewala
review: You may visit this temple if you are also planning for Longewala post visit. This temple is famous owing to some miracle which saved the temple and surrounding from Pakistan mortar and bombs. The bombs and mortars are demonstrated in the temple. While visiting, keep enough stock of water and food and this place does not have decent option for food and water. You will get water at premises but water is too salty so better carry packaged drinking water.

title: mind blogging!!
review: it was totally diffrent from my expectations......

title: Temple at Pak Border
review: Very peace full will never feel like we are hardly 10 KM far from border will feel very good if you can attain aarti on time

title: A sacred place for the Hindus in Rajasthan
review: A Hindu temple but it was a little shocking to see live rats scampering everywhere, even running over the feet of humans, each to his own !!

title: maintained by Indian army
review: It is a temple maintained by our Indian army.It should be on the itinery of every traveller.I also saw lots of beautiful birds en route to the temple.

title: Temple maintained by BSF
review: A must visit place. You can see sand dunes on the way to the temple. Temple is about 125 kms. from Jaisalmer. If you wish to visit to have a closer look at India Pakistan Border, you have to take prior permission from BSF Office at Jaisalmer.

title: If you believe then visit
review: Far away from the city. would recommend only weather permitting as it gets too hot in the day to venture outside

title: Really nice mandir to visit in Jaisalmer area
review: This mandir is a very quite place near the border of Pakistan.  Make sure you get permission to continue to the border, as they will let you go all the way to the border past the mandir.

title: A nice peaceful place near border.
review: We visited after Longewala visit. The place is quite simple. There is arrangement for night stay at Dharmashala. The rout from Longewala to Tanot Mata Temple is awesome. We spotted Fox and Chinkara. Road is well maintained. Availability of filtered cool drinking water was bonus.

title: Good and Truth of Blessing Temple
review: Visited a True Blessing Temple. Tanot Mata Temple located near India Pakistan border. Run and maintain by BSF. You can see live bombs and rockets which is fired by Pakistan army in the war but did not blast. Must visit place for the Desh Bhakt. We enjoyed live with army and knew something about them.

title: Great location. Hidden gem
review: The place is connected to Jaisalmer nice roads maintained by the BRO (Borsder Roads Organisation). Great temple and location nearby the Indo-Pak border a lot of dunes can be seen on the road from Jaisalmer

title: Nice places
review: Arti is very good .

title: Temple maintained by BSF - Belief and Blessings
review: This is the border temple where none of the missiles dropped by Pakistani troops exploded. The belief and blessings of the god to help the bravery of BSF.

title: Awesome temple maintained by BSF
review: We visited Tanot Mata temple en route to Border Post 609. The temple is maintained by BSF and during the 1971 war with Pakistan, the bombs dropped on the temple did not burst, though the surrounding villages got destroyed. Should you wish to visit this divine temple of Goddess Tanot Mata, try to leave early from Jaisalmer. It takes roughly 2 to 2 1/2 hours to reach the temple. There are no restaurants around the place so leaving early would ensure that you can return back early. Else you are suggested to take a packed lunch with you. This temple might also be visited, should you plan a visit to Longewala, where the famous battle of 1971, India Pak war was fought. You have to leave your shoes outside the temple (Like any other temple). However, there is nobody to oversee your shoes. The BP 609 is around 20 km from the temple but permission needs to be taken should you intend to visit the border.

title: Great Visit
review: Mata Tanot Rai Temple Visit is memorable  With Exploration Of The Vast Thar Desert. Enjoyed a lot in the Trip. One Can't imagine That there can be a such large temple in this desert.

title: A divine place at the border
review: We had been to Tanot Mata Temple with family. The temple is maintained by the BSF who is responsible for gaudring our boarders. We had participated in the evening aarti and it was a blissful experience for almost an hour.There are a lot of devotees who come and the temple gets crowded during the aarti time. The temple has survived through the attacks from Pakistan. It is believed that if you tieup a hankey/ shall at Mata's temple and make a wish, It will necessarily come true.

title: Beautiful ride up to the temple; temple is well maintained and clean
review: Hired a Classic 350 from near the fort in Jaisalmer and rode out ~150km (on some of the most beautiful roads I have ever seen) to get there. As you can imagine - this was more about the journey than the end; what with the dunes, endless landscapes without a human in sight and flawless tarmac (and of course the dull hum of the glorious bike we picked).

title: EXCELLENT
review: The same famous temple, which is in Border Movie also, must visit place once you r in Jaisalmer . Jai Mata Di

title: Awesome place
review: This place is in Thar Desert so the heat level is maximum. Best way to enjoy this place is to rent a bike from Jaisalmer and ride it upto Tanot.

title: The Miracle Mandir
review: We started from Jaisalmer at about 2p.m which we thought was little late but it was not much of a problem as the road through out the journey was superb. We reached Tanot via Ramgarh Langewala. It took 2 n 1/2 hours to reach Tanot as we stopped at Ramgarh for snacks and visited Langewala Battle Field also. While we returned directly to Ramgarh via Ghantiyali Mata Mandir. Tanot Mata Mandir is beautifully located and well-maintained by the BSF. Inside you can find un-exploded Shells. Pak army had dropped several thousand of them during 1965 war and none of them exploded by the blessing of Tanot Mata. A must visit for Indian tourist visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Fantastic drive to the place~
review: The temple is okay, holds great significance to the military who consider Tanot Mata as their guardian angel. The drive though, is definitely divine. Loong undulating curvy roads built by the BRO (paramilitary engineer corps), through the rough dunes of the desert with no one but you and your car and the odd camel for company, zooming through at high speeds in the desert country - amazing.

title: Visit to Tanot
review: This is situated about 140kms away from Jaisalmer city but the road condition was very good so we didn’t feel tired. This historic place is very famous among the army people out there. The story behind this temple is during Indo-Pak war Pakistani bomb didn’t blast on this temple and the unexploded bombs are still there in temple for display. The temple is very simple yet beautiful.

title: must visit
review: road from jaisalmer to tanot mata temple is beautiful with sand dunes on both sides of the road. The ride upto tanot temple is good

title: Life time experience!!!
review: Temple is located in border area of India Pakistan, approx 100-120 km far from Jaisalmer.

title: nice place
review: as i am deeply religious, somebody told me that i should visit this place. on visiting this temple i felt very positive energy inside me ... the feeling that i can't describe in words. whole temple is well managed by BSF.

title: Lovely Idol of Tanot Mata
review: This temple  is  around 130 kms from Jaisalmer & is  linked to the  history  of 1965 war . The temple  is nicely maintained by BSF.  The  Idol is  beautiful .

title: Beautiful temple having a history

review: The famous temple in 1965 war, simply enigmatic experience at this wonderful place... Just awesome and magnificent feeling....

title: Tanot Mata Temple

review: Visit to Jaisalmer is incomplete without a visit to Tanot Mata temple and if possible one should visit the border area also, which is around 20 kms from Tanot.

title: Tanot mata Temple
review: It is a well maintained Temple by BSF . the Belief and Faith of Local people and BSF People is very muchon the Goddess. Nice Place to Visit , there are also some Live bombs which didnt explode at the time of 1970's Indo pak war.

title: Patriotic feeling comes automatically
review: Awesome place . Must go. Your trip is incomplete to Jaisalmer . If u miss the loungewala post .. and tanot temple.

title: A must-visit!
review: Not a religious person myself, I was reluctant to visit this place at first. But, since I had time to spare and my family wanted to visit this, I gave it a try. Best. Decision. Ever. The drive from Jaisalmer to Tanot is so beautiful and amazing that words aren't enough to describe it. The highway is super-smooth and very well maintained. The highways cuts its way through mountain like sand dunes and gives one a chance to witness bedouin life of the nearby villages.

title: Little known temple will bring out the patriotic feelings
review: The temple is located about 150 kms from Jaisalmer, close to Longewala. It is maintained by the border security force and contains a collection of bombs that were dropped by Pak forces.

title: Don't miss this place if you are in Jaisalmer
review: Any trip to Jaisalmer is not complete with out a visit to Tanot mata. The border security forces have their faith in the spiritual powers of the deity, and they maintain this temple premises. A ride/drive to tanot takes you through a real desert, each and every bit of which is an enchanting experience in itself.

title: Magical Place
review: If you are visiting jaisalmer you must have this place in your itinerary. This is place where during ind pak war around 450 war heads were fried but none of them exploded. They have kept few of them at display in the temple.

title: Very spiritual
review: Mata Tanot temple is spiritual and historical temple which is located at India-Pakistan border. Very easy to each by bus and rented car.

title: Miracle Place
review: Must visit this place if you are planning for Jaisalmer. About 135 kms from Jaisalmer and very near to border. This temple is very important for Indian Army. You must  own vehicle or rent it to visit. Public transport is not available very frequently. Remote Location so better you return from before night. Just take a look of history on Google and you will be keen to visit this place.

title: Serene and Motivational
review: Tanot Temple is a History in itself and one gets a feeling of serenity and calm being there; with no hustle bustle of temple fervour. The 'Pujari' (Priest) goes about his routine in a proper fashion and they say one can tie a kerchief with a wish there and on fulfillment of that wish, one must visit again to untie the kerchief. Toilet amenities etc are available at this site, which is well managed by the Border Security Force. The drive through Ramgarh (Sholay movie fame) and wilderness is nice for someone who doesn't travel to deserts much.

title: Beautiful and serene
review: Wonderful experience in visiting the Tanot mata temple. The weather is good in winters and the roads are good. The surrounding area of the temple has large sand dunes. The temple is well maintained.

title: Must Visit if you come to Jaisalmer
review: Ride to Tanot Mata Temple was amazing with scenic views of the desert. The Pak army artillery fired during the war did not go off and are still kept framed in the temple. It was a divine experience at the temple, the temple management by BSF is excellent. The most cooperative management ever seen at any temple across the country.

title: Temple near Border and great dunes in nearby area
review: Tanot Mata temple is located just 19km before India-Pakistan border. Tanot village is known as the last village of India close to the border. Temple is maintained by Indian BSF.

title: Unbelievable temple
review: Its unbelievable but its true that the devi of tanot saves of lots of peoples from bumbs attract. This temple is highlighted in border Bollywood movie also.

title: My best trip for ever
review: We had been at Tanot Maata Temple, and Ghantiyali Maata it was a great day for me after visited the Maata, best trip in my life

title: Best of Tanot mata temple
review: We are visiting Tanot tempel. It's really good place. Mandir undertaking at Indian army .nice people & coprative.visit again

title: Tanot Mata Mandir -
review: Jaisalmer visit is incomplete without a visit to this place. In 1971 war Pakistan dropped many bombs on this temple, and none of them were exploded. This is the charisma of Tanot Mata. Even Pakistani officers and soldiers were baffled of this feat, and later on those people also started believing. Unexploded bombs are still kept for display in the Mandir complex.

title: Historical Temple
review: A nice temple being maintained by BSF. It has a huge entrance where you can get handicrafts and artifacts. You can do puja and sit for peaceful time.

title: Very devotional place
review: Must visit if you are towards the spiritual side. Go and make a wish and it will come true, for me it worked. Really I visited it twice. Must see the aarti sung by BSF jawans.

title: wonderful place to visit
review: without visiting Tanot Mata temple, your trip to Jaisalmer is never complete. Please visit Longewala, which is 3 hours by taxi. there is a wonderful temple Tanot mata temple with 2 hours from lonewala.

title: Very interesting!
review: Beautiful and very unique temple! it was great going through it with the guide to understand all the aspects.

title: Very spiritual place must visit.
review: This temple of mata Shakti is a amazing place and has great power in 1965 Pakistan army has dropped more then 400 bombs on the temple but not a single one  exploded you can still see all the bombs there in the temple..must visit place

title: Tanot mata mandir
review: The temple is about 120 Km from Jaisalmer deep inside Thar desert and almost at Pakistan border.The area is not inhabited and is having posting of large Number of Border security forces.The entire temple complex including Pooja ,repair and charity and Prasad distribution is under BSF and they have their own camps in the area and visit the area for prayers etc .

title: Awesome drive from Jaisalmer and onwards to Laungewala
review: The wonderful roads, windmill farm, peace at the temple, excellent samosas at the army run canteen, they all come together for a wonderful must do experience when visiting jaisalmer.

title: Nice temple at Indo Pak border
review: It's located approx.120 Kms away from city. Nicely maintened by BSF. It's well connected with smooth roads. Temple is peaceful & world famous as it's situated near Indo-Pak border.

title: Tanot mata temple
review: Had a long drive of 120 km from jaisalmer to the temple with windmill farm on both sides. Temple is maintained by BSF. BSF also offers food to devotees. The stalls selling artifacts by BSF are also good.

title: Scenic as well as historical
review: So many wars fought between India & Pakistan, but not a scratch on this border temple in the deserts. Worth visiting.

title: A piece of History well maintained
review: This Temple of Tanot Mata is maintained by Army and is maintained in Fauji style i.e neat and clean. Army also runs a small canteen outside.

title: Tanot maa
review: Tanot mata temple gather a history in self during war of laongewala..beautifull temple manage by bsf ..temple is miracle for all solider as well as citizen

title: Miraculous place and awesome dunes on the way
review: Trip from Jaisalmer to Tanot included stopover at some very big and awesome dunes. Sam dunes are dwarf in comparison to dunes on the way here. Tanot mata temple is awesome feeling when you see unexploded bombs on display and read story about them.

title: Amazing Experience at Tanot
review: October 2016 : It is run and maintained by the BSF and it is an experience to be there. Although foreign nationals (meaning non residents of India) are not allowed to go there as it is close to the Border.

title: Cool place.
review: Fullfill faith of soilders on the border. The must visit place when we are in Jaisalmer. In the route we can enjoy the the real desert feel in the small sand hills which are at  bothside of roads.

title: The Diety Who Protected Us
review: The village is very close to Pakisthan border.Its an old temple with a history of India Pakisthan 1965 war.The temple trust is managed by Border Security Force of India

title: Peaceful Place
review: Tabor Rai Mata temple situated near Indo-Pak border. The temple gave us the sense of some mysterious power which constantly remains around us. A place worth visiting.

title: GODDESS OF SOLDIER
review: Tanot mata temple is a religious place where pakistan attack in 1971 by bomb but bomb falls on tanot mata temple did not blast. These bomb still at tanot mata temple. Easy to reach there by road from JAISALMER.

title: Tanot Mata
review: Situated at the Border.Is well prayed by Hindus.People have firm belief on this Goddess.In war time many bombardment done on the temple were missed and is run by a trust of BSF .

title: The last civilian point before Indo-Pak border near Jaisalmer
review: We travelled from Jaisalmer to Tanot, which is about 150 kms towards Indo-Pak border. Excellent roads in the middle of the desert and breathtaking views.

title: Guardian of our soldiers
review: The temple premises and the deity as such are simple and unassuming till one learns of the history behind the place. While we all worship for various reasons, the protective shield that the Goddess has repeatedly put around our brave men is indeed no less than a supernatural occurrence. It is incidences like this and places like these which establish our faith that there is a Supreme power above all of us.

title: Temple protecting our border, managed and maintained by the BSF
review: Located around 120 Kms away from Jaisalmer, this temple is said to be the guardian of our soldiers. In the 1965 Indo-Pak war, Pakistan fired around 3000 bombs around this temple and none of them exploded. The same miracle was witnessed in the war of 1971 as well. The Pakistan General himself visited this place to witness this supernatural happening.

title: well maintained
review: very clean temple maintained by BSF...close to border..real bombs seen here....ATM outside the temple.....

title: Great temple
review: Me and my friends visit this temple it look so great  medal in the thar. Desert and we take many pictures of the temple Because  Its come in India Pakistan border

title: Must visit Temple!!!!!!
review: Shri Tanot Mata temple is worth visiting place for all those who visit Jaisalmer. Quite a famous temple in that region and people hv immense faith in the Devi Ma. There are so many stories about the power of Devi Maa which give protection to the area and soldiers. The extra ordinary incidents during 1971 war has proved the powers of Tanot Mata.

title: Tanot mata ki jai
review: Tanot mata temple is situated in bharat pak border. 120 km away from jaisalmer . between tanot temple and jaisalmer only desert. and also one tv tower this is the biggest in India.

title: Great Patriotic fervour
review: The place is a must visit if you love the country and Army. The aarti performed in morning and evening is a must watch if you are visiting Jaisalmer. You will fall in love with the BSF here.

title: Must visit
review: It's very nice temple (Tanot Maya) our group travel in jaisalmer so we have time to travel Tanot temple  it's 125km  far from jaisalmer enters on Indian Pakistan line

title: Simple but symbol of Army's belief and devotion...
review: This is the only temple managed and maintained fully by BSF.. Clean and comfortably approachble. It gives you less of religious feeling but purely patriotic feeling of BSF base and their belief.. The best part is not to miss, to see the Pak's Bombs which remained unexploded during Ind-Pak war..

title: At pakistan border
review: went there from jaisalmer. It is 120 kms from the city. Nice driveable road and the place is too calm and quite

title: Great temple
review: Me and my friends  visit  this temple it was so great it's near on Pakistan  border in temple we see  some kind of bomb

title: Simple, sober and a nice place to visit
review: Me and my friends visit this temple on the last weekend of Feb 2017. Temple is nicely managed by BSF and the place is very calm. Its 122 km from Jaisalmer and route is quite good. On the route, you can stop in between to have some nice clicks(sand dune, wind mills). Overall its a good experience on the road.

title: Miraculous place
review: Live gun shells are still kept. During 1971 war, everything was distorted except this temple. Now managed beautifully by the Indian Army.

title: Long Drive in Thar Desert to Reach Tanot
review: Tanot is 120km North West of Jaisalmer in Thar Desert of Rajasthan. It is around 2hrs by car. This place is very near to Pakistan border. 6km. Tanot Rai Mata Temple is an old temple with a history of India Pakistan war of 1965. The temple trust is managed by Border Security Force of India. On the route you can visit Ranua village. Keep food & water with you. The 2 hrs drive is the best way to explore culture, people, food habits, vegetation etc. in the desert.

title: A worth visiting temple
review: It takes around 2 hrs from jaiselrmer but worth visiting. It is well developed and maintained by BSF. You can see the unexploded cannons put by pakistan, preserved here.

title: Good pilgrim spot at remote location
review: Tanot mata temple is near to longewala war memorial. We spent 30 mins inside the temple and found very good ambience. We were shocked and surprised to see ATM proxy to the temple. The militants have their small snacks bar, which had decent tea and snacks.

title: Great story of rhe place.
review: The place is located near the border of India and Pakistan which has story that where the temple is located there Pakistan had thrown many missiles. The missiles which were thrown near temple were not burst. Local people said it is the power of god!

title: nice place , good driving experience , BSF is managing the roads extremely well .
review: Temple is neat and clean . thanks to BSF . managed by BSF in a very orederly manner . Driving experience from jaisalmer to tanot is some thing to remember - good roads , good scenery with hundreds of wind mills on the way .

title: Very nice temple
review: Temple was very nice if you are in Jaisalmer then please go at tanot temple when you go there then you feel how was it .

title: Temple with unforgettable history
review: If you are in Jaisalmer and you are visiting longewala border then you should visit this temple because in 1971 war Pakistan dropped 8 bombs on this temple and out of them only 1 got off but the remaining 7 bombs didn't got off.

title: Tanot Mata temple - Oasis in the desert
review: Tanot Mata temple is a famous temple which has guarded the Indian border at longewala and sanjewala and is believed to be so divine that enemy grenades and bombs could not explode during 71 war. Very neat and clean and the aarti was memorable. Maintained by BSF and u feel the vibrations when u r inside the temple. There is a victory post outside the temple which has very nice scripts. Your blood boils for ur motherland once u r standing at the gate. A must visit place from Jaisalmer.

title: Superb - must see place
review: The Tanot Matajee temple is a must see for all the visitors to Jaisalmer. The 125 kms drive is a straight one with good view of the desert as one drives. The temple is an excellent place run by the BSF team. Neat, clean and well kept. The shell that sis not explode when they fell in the vicinity are kept on display. A must see.

title: Unforgettable temple
review: Tanot Mata temple is the first place to visit when you go to Jaisalmer, BSF is handling all the activities of the temple from its caretaking to the artis inside the temple. Best known for its history that how it protects people inside it during the war.

title: A place worth watching and praying.
review: I think this is the best temple where Mata is worshiped by our BSF wings JAWANS and on arriving their some diiferent feelings feels in mind. A salute to our JAWANS and pray to GODESS TANOT Mata.

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: I visited Tanot Mata tmple in evening time for aarti. Really enjoyed it. BSF soldiers maintain this temple and do aarti in evening. Everyone must visit once.

title: A revered ancient temple in the middle of the desert
review: The ancient temple dedicated to Mata Tanot has a more recent history of escaping unscathed during the heavy Pakistani shelling on the post during the wars between the two countries.

title: A Temple to visit while you are in the region
review: This is one of the main attractions around Jaisalmer. This is one temple which is taken care of by BSF (Indian army). You can see the army right at the entrance. Historically the temple has survived cannon and air attack from Pakistan. Miracle states that the canon balls and missiles never exploded after hitting the temple area. And you can also see the unexploded artillery there. It is a revered and divine place for the army as well as civilians.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Tanot Mata temple is very nicely maintained and must see location of jaisalmer . temple is totally maintained by Indian army .

title: Mystical powers apparently but worth the long ride?
review: The deity apparently has mystical powers. The temple is small and maintained by the BSF. It is clean and at the time that we visited (noon on a week day), there were not too many visitors there - just a handful. The atmosphere was nice. However, the 130km ride from Jaisalmer just to see this temple and offer prayers is not my cup of tea. For me it was disappointing after the long ride.

title: Must visit
review: Clean and well maintained by the BSF. You'll be welcomed by friendly attention seeking goats. You can click pictures with them, and also pat them or tough them.

title: unforgettable visit
review: the ancient temple belongs to mata tarnot . this temple maintained by indian army . would recommend this to all .

title: Road to happiness & peace!
review: Tanot Mata Temple as we all know, is a historical site with significance. If visited with faith all your wishes shall come true and your prayers shall be answered. A temple worth visiting and the journey to the temple is definitely a road to happiness and peace.

title: Good holistic place
review: Tanot temple a good holistic place to visit it's must see location of Jaisalmer . Temple maintained. By Indian army.

title: The power of Devotion!
review: Located near the India-Pakistan border, the temple has an interesting story related to the 1971 war. The patriotic Indians could pay a visit to the temple covering the Longewala memorial as well on the way back. The visit could use up one full day.

title: Great Place to Visit in India
review: It is situated at 120 km from Jaisalmer city. You can reach here easily by hiring the tourists vehicles. The Temple of Hindu Goddess here is a great attraction due to faith and belief of the Indian Soldiers. It is believed that during the heavy Bomb shelling by enemy from cross border not even a single bomb exploded here, and all this is due to the power of goddess only.

title: Wnoderful temple of 'Tanot Mata'
review: The temple is situated near the Indo-Pak border which is about 5kms from there.The temple lies in the military area and You cannot move around near the temple without permission from the military base.But Architecture of the temple reflects the local architecture style of Jaisalmer.

title: Little bit of History mixed with lots of Mythology
review: The temple proudly displays the Pakistani shells that did not explode around the temple. The temple has a lot of following amongst the BSF who also are responsible for its maintenance and upkeep. It's not much of a sight honestly if you aren't the religious type like me. The drive is scenic as it passes through sand dunes and quaint little villages. Overall, do this only in combination with Longewala memorial. On its own it's not much of an attraction.

title: Divine
review: The place not only offers a relook into the history of indo pak war but it also is a place for the young ones to see the Border and see the grit n determination of Indian Army Jawans which makes one feel that we owe a salute to these jawans who make us feel so safe n secure, as they toil hard at temperatures over 50'C. Take prior permission to visit the border ...

title: Blessings
review: Tanot temple one of the most amazing places in jaisalmer is situated near Pakistan border. The army does the holy chantings there and that's mesmerizing. The beleif that the god keeps them safe during hard time is really amusing.

title: Located far from Jaiselmer
review: A beautiful temple with war memories between India and Pak during 1965 war. ATM, Small canteen are thr.

title: Incredible to see
review: It's awesome to hear from the soldiers about the non working of the cellphone our enemy on the temple, and the life of the soldiers are really hard there, since a very little no of people visiting this place and only Indians are allowed to visit, because it's 150 km long only sandy tillas having beautiful but dangerous landscape views, it's worth traveling and a matter of great interest.

title: do not miss this, and no restriction for foreigners
review: well its bit far from city but totally worth it. drive is hassle free, just look out for speedbumps till ramgarh, drive is scenic, very less traffic, u shouldnt miss this amazing part of state.

title: Amazing historic place
review: Whole temple complex is maintained and run by Indian army.

title: Tanot temple one of the most amazing places in jaisalmer is situated near Pakistan border.
review: It's awesome to hear from the soldiers aboutTanot temple one of the most amazing places in jaisalmer is situated near Pakistan border.

title: Wishes gets full filled!
review: A peaceful temple located near the border.  Known for the wishes that the God fulfills. Maintained very well by BSF. Find your peace.

title: temple with bombs
review: at the edge of India.....at the border of Pakistan....unexploded bombs are on display. They were fired by Pakistan but the power of the Goddess protected the Indians. The army people all come here regularly to pray.

title: Must visit
review: Really peace and you will amazed with quality of cleanses maintained by BSF. Must visit. Still live bombs are placed in the temple.

title: Lifetime memories!
review: Tanot Mata temple is hugely recognized in Jaisalmer! Go there, not just for the sake of the religious sentiments, but with an intention to visit our Border Post 609 located further ahead!

title: WAR Temple
review: A beautiful temple near Indo-Pak border. This temple was got attacked by many Pakistani bombs in 1965 india pakistan war but not a single bomb got reached at execution level. you can still watch bombs and other artillery in temple .

title: Such a Holy and Patriotic Place..!!
review: Tannot Mata is a temple in western State of Rajasthan in District Jaisalmer of India. As per the oldest Charan literature Tannot Mata is new clone of divine goddess Hinglaj Mata, and than after Tannot Mata becomes Karni Mata, And known as Goddess Of Charan's. Tannot Basically The village is close to the border with Pakistan, and is very close to the battle site of Longewala of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, indeed some credit the temple for the outcome of the battle.[1] Tourists cannot go beyond this temple to see the Indo–Pak Border unless one gets the relevant documentation in advance from the District and Military Authorities. It is now a tourist destination in India. The area is said to have oil and gas reserves

title: Tanot Rai Mata mandir
review: Drive to & back from Jaisalmer ( about 120 kms one way) is out of world. High Sand Dunes and sweeping Desert scenery makes road trip enjoyable.

title: Great place
review: I visit tanot mataji temple with my family members. This is great auspicious place which is approx 120 km from jaiselmer.this temple is maintained by our great BSF soldiers who is very cooperative,friendly ,helpful n humble. In this temple pakistani army general also visited there after 1971 war because of tanot mataji mircale. really this is great peaceful place.

title: very close to Longewala war museum in Jaisalmer
review: Visitors who are visiting longewala post in Jaisalmer also must visit this temple .. it is very famous in this place & a nice place for worship for devi maa

title: Well arranged and clean
review: Simple and nice place to visit. We went there to see the unexploded shells bombarded on temple in 1965 and 1971 by Pakistani army.. The miracle that none exploded is really worth witnessing by ourself

title: Nice Drive and Good Experience
review: The drive to Tanot is a nice experience. Visit to the temple is a must by all Indians as it has nice story and history. If one takes permission from BSF at Jaisalmer then one can visit Border Post here which is about 10 kms and again very good experience. One MUST arrange permission in advance. There is a small eatery here run by BSF, but best is to carry own food and water from Jaisalmer.

title: Temple managed by BSF
review: It is an awesome temple which is managed by the BSF personnel and is the last point where civilians can go before Jaisalmer border. Unexploded Pakistan bombs kept in the temple are the point of attraction for everyone.

title: Guardian of the Indian Border
review: Tanot Mata temple and the surrounding area are managed and maintained by BSF round the year. The mata is considered and revered as guardian of Indian Border here.

title: Good only for religious reasons
review: Otherwise it's not worth driving 120 kms from jaiselmer. I did the Jaisalmer-Tanot - Longewal- Jaiselmer. It's very scenic drive but the mobile phone network is jammed due to sensitivity of border area , hence make sure you have tank full (Ramgarh is the last filling point) and good in condition vehicle for this lonely drive.

title: Proudly Say "Jai Mata Di"
review: We Visit this Temple with imagination of Movie Border Tanot Mata Temple but Now this Place become like Army Headquarters cum Big Tourist Place Temple..

title: Good place
review: There are no petrol pumps nearby make sure to have your tanks full before going to this place as this place is located near border area

title: Tanot Mata Temple - Must go
review: We a couple had travelled to this place on Dec 27th'2016. Our Rajathan trip' intenerary did not have 'Tanot Mata temple visit' in the list. In fact we heard about it after we reached Jaisalmer. We had very less time but somehow we both felt like going. Infact the decision of visiting the temple turned out to be great. 22 kms from Pak border, shown in Border movie, legends are known about mata's power. You can google. We booked a cab from Jaisalmer, started at 3 pm & it took 2 hrs to reach. The whole temple is run by BSF. Since it was evening time, we witnessed the aarti. I must say we were lucky to take part in Mata's arti. Odd 100 BSF jawans came  during aarti, it gave goosebumps seeing the jawans doing the arti. Make sure whenever you travel Tanot Mata temple, you must attend the aarti. Inside the campus also present Mata mansa devi temple. You can tie rumaal their with mannat. We spent 2-3 hrs at temple & I wont forget the experience whole life. It was dark when we started to return back. On the way visited 'Ghantial Mata' temple. Reached Jaisalmer by night.

title: Spituality and Patriotism Mix
review: The temple is nice and quaint and has an interesting history due to its upkeep by the BSF jawans, Try and combine with a trip to the India - Pak border. Need special permission - take an Indian photo identity. Also visit nearly Longeval war museum. Altogether a 6-7 hour round trip from Jaisalmer

title: A Must visit
review: We travelled to this place on Dec 13th'2016. Though it was not a part of our trip but then we were on our honeymoon and so we made it a point to visit the famous temple. We drove from Sam dunes to Longewala and from there to Tanot Mata mandir. The whole temple is run by BSF. We  witnessed the aarti completely organised by BSF.

title: It amazing
review: This is very good temple. This is like a normal temple but famous. You also enjoy the way of this. Please visit

title: Shree Tanot Mata Temple. At Western Border.
review: It is world Famous Place.

title: A piece of history
review: Only two hours from Jaisalmer, the temple opens only after 9.30. Also, since there is not much rush except on special days (one can find out from Jaisalmer) one can start leisurely from Jaisalmer,.

title: Must go
review: Its 123 km away from desert tulip resort.a road trip through desert passing Ghantaliya mandir ,sand teelas,BSF head quarters .final destination comes.pakistan bombarded 300 shells no one blast at mandir premises.a devi of *veer gatha".BSF take cares of area and situated at border line

title: A Holy Place
review: The mandir is situated at around 125 km from Jaisalmer and is of great importance since it was bombed by hundreds of bombs but none of them actually exploded and are kept as a relic. The place is  maintained by BSF and is about 20km from the India Pakistan border. The temple is open for tourists but nobody could go further without prior permission.

title: Nice place with live bombs inside the temple of 1971 war.
review: Very Nice place, with some live bombs inside the temple. BSF trust managed it really nicely, unlike other crowded temples.

title: Makes you feel proud and devoted
review: The history behind the temple is quite recent and strong. Plus the place is managed by the Indian Army, so everything is in order. No one expects you to put money in the collection boxes. One of the best-managed temples I have seen.

title: Visit if you have faith in God
review: You shall visit this place if have faith in God. The people have belief that the rockets/bombs targeted to this temple did not exploded due to divine power of goddess. Those rockets/bombs were also kept  temple. The temple is managed by BSF trust and you wont find any flower shops inside mandir. No one will insist you inside temple compound to bye flower or other worship things. Complete cleanliness is maintained. You can take photos inside temple. No entry fees. You can plan to visit this temple while visiting Longewala war museum. Nothing more to see here and not much photo points.

title: The Miracle.
review: It is said that the Tanot Temple remained unscathed and untouched during the India-Pakistan War. There were war bullets everywhere, but it didn't manage to harm the temple. It is a tourist attraction with lots of goats on all sides. Be careful of them, but truly a mesmerising experience.

title: amazing place to visit
review: Tanot mata temple is one of the complesary place to visit while travelling to jaisalmer. temple was maiantained by army persons.

title: Historically important place
review: Nice place. Beware of sheeps (gheta).. they can be dangerous.

title: MUST VISIT
