review: The temple is 120 km away from jaisalmer but is a must visit temple. If one wants to visit the indo-pak border then one must inquire about the official formalities required before reaching Tanot temple. Plan your visit as per the Aarti timings (Morning / evening)

title: The temple of patriotism
review: A quaint place 123 Kms away from Jaisalmer which boasts of many heroics of the Indian Army. It has decorated very proudly indeed two show cases storing the unexploded shells fired from across the border but which refused to explode. The story has it that the shells were fired to destroy the temple but it refused to explode and such is the great blessings of the divine mother Durga. The ambiance is clean. The temple is maintained by BSF. Only thing which lacks  is a proper cafeteria for the visitors who travel a total of nearly 350 Kms up and down from Jaisalmer to visit the temple.

title: Religion and Faith at its peak
review: I visited this place after war museum amazing trip just to understand about the reality of bombs. Indian Army does some type of worship and songs there but the environment is electrifying during that period. A must watch for everyone

title: Not just a religious site but historical place too
review: If you are visiting Longewala then you should visit this place too.

title: good place to see
review: good place to see just near to pakintan border totally maintained by indian army salute to army good one

title: Holy place to visualize Power of GOD
review: nice place to visit, only temple  we visited in my trip.. quite and serene place.. on d way to longewala checkpost.. it still hv those shells and mortar which were bombarded in 1971 war by pakistan but all those landed inside temple primises could not get explode.. no scientific logic for that.. only power of god..

title: Wonderful Place!
review: Wonderful place to visit for devotees. The temple is well maintained by BSF. There is not much rush and Darshan happens pretty much once you are in the temple. Some Great War history is associated with this Temple and it is worth a visit to take blessings of Tannot mata.

title: Amazing day trip
review: If you are a religious person, I do not have to convince you to be there. It is a temple after all. But even if you are an atheist, you must visit this place. First you get to see all real bomb shells which were fired on us, but didnt explode and secondly you will get to see the most beautiful and virgin tracks of sand dunes undisturbed by hoards of tourist. The real raw beauty of the Thar desert is what you get to see on the way. And it is a far better place to be in comparison to the commercialized and over crowded camel safari sites.

title: Lovely Place
review: Lovely place to visit, it feels really good to see Pakistani Bombs and Mata Darshan ! Must Visit place

title: Perfect location
review: One sentence- "must go to place"

title: Tanot Rai Mata Temple
review: we really had mesmerizing experience at Tanot Mata Temple, without this your jaisalmer trip is incomplete. BSF has really done great job by building and maintaining the temple.

title: Only if you have time
review: 115 kms from Jaisalmer. Its not the temple but the road which is worth enjoying. The temple is newly built and not a historic place.

title: MY DREAM TO VISIT TANOT MATA TEMPLE
review: I had read about Tanot in one of travel blog and decided to visit as a must. Recently in November 2016, got an opportunity to visit Jaisalmer as part of Rajasthan tour. We left early after breakfast and it was a pleasant drive to Tanot.

title: miracles mata
review: must visit to Thank her for saving our country in times of distress,you feel there is some super power.

title: AMAZING RELIGIOUS PLACE IN REMOTE DESERT
review: My wife and me really had mesmerizing experience at Tanot Mata Temple, without this your jaisalmer trip is incomplete.120 kms from Jaisalmer. The road which is worth enjoying and experience the desert. BSF has really done great job by building and maintaining the temple.

title: Its good but don't keep high expectations
review: This temple is situated 120 KM far from Jaisalmer, its good to see this once but do not keep high expectations. we thought we will see real desert in this route but there is nothing. If you have time then go there otherwise not.

title: The most amazing temple with History
review: The history of this temple is known. The temple is manned and maintained by army and is a worth visit. Tanot mata alongwith Longewala are the attraction of Jaisalmer

title: The Deity Who Saved Us All
review: The temple is around 120 Km from Jaisalmer, Roughly takes 2-3 hours to reach. Most of the road is good, but for small patches. Its better to start early after breakfast and carry some eatables and water. You would not be able able to find anything on the way, till you get back to Jaisalmer, in the evening. The roads are completely deserted, but extremely safe.

title: Awesome on the way view
review: If you first time seeing dunes India, it just must place to go.. It is near the indo pak border.

title: A must visit place if you are interested in Indian War History
review: The Tanot Mata Mandir is 153 KMS from Jaisalmer and its a beautiful drive through the Thar Desert.

title: holly feelings
review: this temple is located near border and story behind it really amazing. It is said to have been saved by the powers abode during tge indo pak war

title: Amazing Journery till the Mandir
review: Pls visit this mandir, you will feel blessed with inner peace, the entire stretch is very scenic and beautifull.

title: A exciting place to visit near Border
review: This is very good Temple, managed by BSF,

title: Must visit if you have time
review: The drive is super, you pass through sections which have just sand on either side of the road which is what I wanted to see. Near the border is an amazing feeling.

title: Good holy place
review: It was a worthy visit of this temple. Very good atmosphere with it's history and lots of visitors were there to have blessings of Mata.

title: Long drive to place near the border
review: If one wants to go for a long drive, this is the road where one should go, both on bike or car. Road trip is paradise for photogenic places, dessert, wind mills. And finally temple is the main attraction in jaisalmer that one need to visit. Story, location is perfect and well maintained by BSF. Try to reach the temple early morning or late evening when BSF persons do aarti which is must to see.

title: Lovely  view  of desert
review: Must do if u want to see tha real thar PS no network  over there (ramghar

title: Nice place
review: Quite crowded and lots of people visiting it. Nice carvings inside. Too many steps have to be climbed. those with knee pain may find it difficult to climb up.

title: A Place of Faith for BSF!
review: If you visited Jaisalmer, it's must to visit Tanot Mata Temple and Longewala.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: Tanot Mata Temple 120 Km From Jaisalmer | Village Tanot, Jaisalmer very popular and historical temple dedicated to mata tanot roy. indo pak war pakistani sena bomb  defuse and pakistani sena   fight together and die.

title: Perfect blend of bravery, faith and trust
review: A wonderful experience. The bravery of our soldieries in those difficult locations (high temp. & sand around) and their faith in Goddess Tanot for protecting them is a great example of trust. It is motivating them to give their best for the country. I salute & respect them for protecting us. Really needs to be seen to believe. Vande Matram

title: Mata temple
review: Filling peace and nice. At mata rani temple.

title: Tanot temple..no bomb can destroy it..
review: Tanot temple came to limelight after India Pak war..around 400+ bombs landed on Indian soil by Pakis but not even a single bomb was able to destroy this temple..around 10+ landed in the vicinity of the temple and none of the those exploded...after this incident, Indian army was motivated and they defeated Pak army..

title: Religion mixed with patriotism
review: The place has a lot of value in the local community. Lots of famous people have visited the place. It is said to have been saved by the powers abode during tge indo pak war. To substantiate this, there are few unexploded mortar shells kept at display. I did not find the place very spectacular given the distance I had to travel from jaisalmer, but it comes as a package with longewala so it's ok.

title: jai mata ji
review: miracle place actually a temple it is said to be a place where nothing got destroy in 1971 in pak bombarding. the bombs Pakistan dropped by planes and tanks didn't explode coz of mata temple area and are still kept for for tourists.

title: The drive is with it
review: You'll see more dunes driving to the temple than going to the tourist places like Sam. It was super hot when we went there. Take prior permission if you wanna visit the border.

title: Army temple...
review: The story is that during the 1965 war , none if the shells that fell in the vicinity of the temple, the a small shrine, exploded. This motivated the Indian army and they fought with renewed vigor.

title: Great to feel like soldiers
review: Tabitha Devi is an place right at the boarder like Longowal and was on target of Pakistan bombing but not even a single bomb could damage it, the temple is maintained and run by our BSF and have a very positive vibes,if you are at Jaisalmer and u r an Indian I would recommend u to visit this temple and also go to Longowal

title: Spiritual Place
review: This temple is very divine place for our soldiers with tourist. During the so many bombs fired but didn't blast. Here when you visit do proper planing.

title: Spiritual Air Around!!
review: Managed by Army, its a temple close to border with unbelievable stories that stands true. The path reaching this temple will offer vivid colour of landscape of real Rajasthan.

title: security, food, free stay, indo pak border area
review: i think the best way to reach this temple (for a budget traveller) is take a government bus from jaisalmer which starts at 4 p.m. and drops you at TANOT at 7 p.m.

title: Good place
review: Good place, heard about it how the place was not affected even after Pakistani attack. The place is maintained by our military . We had the permission to visit our border so this point was our check point.

title: Adventure of thar jaisalmer rajasthan
review: Nice place. Of tanot mata temple  jaisalmer

title: Nice temple
review: Beautiful temple. U can visit this temple before going to longewala. Nice place. Try requesting the bsf chief. U may get a chance to visit the border pillar.

title: Jai Tanot Mata
review: 120 km from jaisalmer and 15 km from border, protected from enemy. It will change your meaning of trip to Jaisalmer. Brings out the True Indian within you through devotion. One can know more about the stories through Localites.

title: A must visit for Indian.
review: This temple if located 120 kms from jaisalmer. It's a must visit for any Indian who loves his country and who is proud of Indian army. This temple takes u back in 1965 when there was a war between India and Pakistan. How this Goddess helped Indians by diffusing huge size bombs with her power, u can have a glimpse of them at the temple. This temple is maintained by Indian army. Their poojaris are all soldiers. One should not miss the evening Arti. Accommodation for night stay is available but one needs prior booking. Food is served by through bhandaras. They have a small canteen also which is very reasonable.

title: A temple with a War History
review: The place I will suggest for tourist who are interested in bit of history/patriotic and religion. The temple is a long haul from Jaisalmer and falls 120Kms,there is no other major tourist destination in the route...which makes it a stand alone journey.

title: Well Maintained Temple by BSF
review: Jai Mata Di..it's is a very nice movie which was untouched by the indo-pak war that happened in 1961. The BSF have maintained it well. We did a one day visit that covered this along with longewala museum. It's 120km from Jaisalmer.

title: Holy place maintained by army
review: The journey to this temple is Awsome. The road to this place is beautiful, through dessert. I really enjoyed. The temple is beautiful & is located close to border. Worth to visit.

title: Mata ka Mandir (Border)
review: Its the famous Mata Ka Mandir that you may have first witnessed in movie Border. Unique specialty being that the the ammo did not blast at this temple. Peaceful place to visit.

title: Amazing Temple *****
review: Visiting this temple gives immense pleasure and blessings of Tanot Mata. Temple is situated just before the Indo Pak border and it is said the temple was showered with Bombs but    the temple was unaffected and no bomb exploded by grace of Tanot Mata. Unexploded Bombs are displayed in the temple premises.

title: Lovely temple with relaxing atmosphere
review: Feel really nice!! Had amazing time. Will definitely come back again. Never miss the place if at all planning to come to jaisalmer. A big temple given security by BSF.

title: Best temple ever :)
review: Had amazing time.  A big temple given security by BSF.  This place is about 1110 km away from jaisalmer.

title: Visited temple
review: This is a very nice temple of Mata Tanot. Visited this temple from Hotel Tokyo Palace. The temple is one of the best seen.This is the best hotel in my Indian trip. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: Amazing experience..Its 120km from Jesalmer. Road is very good. Temple maintained by BSF. Cleanness, Facilities are upto the mark. Must visit this place if you come for Rajasthan trip....

title: Divine place
review: From jaisalmer we reached Tanot Mata Mandir at 12 o'clock afternoon .Road is in nice condition .Very less traffic.As we travel sight around road is full of sand dunes and bushes.After reaching there went to temple.Its great place fully charged and divine.Its maintaind by BSF people. U can take rest under large hall covered by tin shed.Also there is display of pakistani bombs which didnt exploded due to Mata rani's power. Aarti timing are morning and evening only.U cannot go ahead without permission from jaisalmer BSF office permission as its border area.Nearest site to visit is Longiwala  battle field from there.

title: Divine feeling
review: A place right in the mid of isolated deserts of Jaisalmer.

title: Nice Temple  surrounding sand dunce
review: Best temple to visit in Jaisalmer, surrounding by sand dunce. In  1971 INDO-POK war 3000 booming by POK but No damage to India army. BSF Serve the temple.one of best place to visit in Jaisalmer ,way to temple are full of Nature.

title: Well Maintained Temple by Indian Army
review: A must visit destination if you are in Jaisalmer. This temple is closer to the border area and has historic significance.

title: "Tanot temple is Unbelievable "
review: 120 km drive & the feeling of being an Indian. A must visit place for any traveler to jaisalmer.

title: Don't forget a trip to Tanot Mata mandir, if visiting Jaisalmer!
review: This temple has a great significance for BSF. The live bombs are still lying there inside the temple which were fired by Pakistan during the war of 1971. The entire mortar which fell in and around the temple misfired! This fact itself is enough to give u goose bumps!

title: Jai mata di
review: Awesome feeling,the miracle place where in 1965 war Pakistan drop hundreds of bombs but none exploded n now kept in here in the temple of tanot mata ji great

title: Peaceful Place
review: A very well managed , clean and orderly temple. Special thanks to BSF to take interest in its upkeep.

title: far but beautiful idol
review: It is bit far from Jaisalmer. Those who have absolute agenda of visiting a temple should go. Place is serene and good for those who believe in goddess.

title: Religious place
review: This temple is around 120 km from jaisalmer. This temple is maintained and managed by border security force. It is said that during india pakistan war, pakistani army attacked this temple with bombs and granades. More than 100 granades and bombs were thrown around this temple but this temple remained untouched . Tanot mata 's blessings are always with indian army. You can see those granade shells in temple complex. A must visit place if travelling jaisalmer.

title: just the perfect peace and relaxation
review: in between the sand dunes the perfect place with the great history...... fully maintained by the Indian army ..... a place full of positive energy    "Jai Mata Di"

title: JAI TANOT MATA
review: Temple is situated  on boarder of india and pakistan boarder and location is really mind blowing and one must visit this temple if he / she is at jaisalmet

title: Divine temple which bombs could not destroy
review: This is a famous temple with many followers. It's about 130kms from Jaisalmer on the Indo-pak border. The temple is well maintained  with a subsidised  canteen, toilet facilities and drinking water.

title: Unforgettable Visit to Tanot Mata Shrine
review: No visit to Jaisalmer is complete without visiting the Tanot Mata Temple.  One of the rare shrines in the country which is shared by a Pir Baba and a Hindu Goddess.  The last point upto which civilians are allowed.  This temple is also site of the historical Indo Pak war of 1971. History says that even thoough the surroundings were completely destroyed the temple shrine remained unaffected.  The place is neat and clean and the temple priest ever willing to share interesting tit bits about the temple.  The army authorities there were smiling and willing to part with interesting titbits about the place.

title: A divine temple amongst Nature..
review: This place is about 130 km away from Jaisalmer city and near to India/pakistan border.

title: Good Place
review: Good Place for Visit which is mange by Indian Army. Connecting road is also good and Indo Pak border is just 22 kilometer far from this place.

title: Know the myth, see the evidence
review: History has it that when Pakistan tried to bomb the area, the shells felll all around the Tanot area but not on Mata's temple....and those that fell did not explode. You can see the shells inside the temple. An interesting side show are the wild goats

title: See the power of allmighty !!
review: This temple is managed by BSF. It is very nice and you feel presence of allmighty when you see the displayed bombs that did fall during indo pak war but did not explode.

title: Magical one
review: Beautiful temple in beautiful location, and aarti is mind blowing. Here aarti and all other work organised and taken care by army, to see there enthusiasm & dedication can't expressed in words. Tue & Friday crowded.

title: tample which is lookafter by indian army
review: Tannot Mata is a temple in western State of Rajasthan in District Jaisalmer of India. As per the oldest Charan literature Tannot Mata is new clone of divine goddess Hinglaj Mata

title: only general pics in temple
review: don't expect much from this place. if you are a devotee then do visit else it's waste coz inside temple there only supervior general pics giving prizes to student everywhere, looks like an advertisement instead of anything from 1971 war

title: Temple near to  tanot border
review: When you are visiting the tanot border then you can visit this temple from here entry is made in the post if you are going towards border .photography is not allowed near the border and don't even try !!!

title: Nice Place to visit, if you are in Jaisalmer
review: The temple is maintained by Border Security Force (BSF of India). The temple and its surroundings are extremely clean. The funny thing over there was that there was a officer of BSF employed only to not let many sheep enter the temple :) I even got a permit to visit the India-Pakistan Border (BP 609), where I had interaction with a bunch of BSF officers, posted over there. You can see the fence and even Pakistan's territory separated by a small stone pillar from a watch tower.

title: Having lot of historic importance.
review: Definately great place to be in as lot of history attached to this including india Pakistan war way back

title: Tanot Mata temple visit in rajasthan
review: On my journey to Jaislmer, Rajasthan, heard about Tanot Mata temple.

title: Really nice
review: We went to Tanot mata temple which is 120 km away from jaisalmer. Bt the faith made us go so far to see d temple. The temple is nice bt dont expect restaurant etc nearby.

title: Must goooooo.....
review: Must goooooo. ... and if any one wants to see the border. Plz take the permission from BSF Office @ jaisalmer prior. And you will get the permission very easily.

title: Must Go to feel the power of God
review: Tanot mata mandir is situated around 120 km from jaisalmer city . There are beautiful deserts on the way . The aarti time is 6:45-7:45 in evening and morning. The aarti is sing by BSF armymen , and u will feel there energy and devotion when they sing and do the aarti. For stay there is a common Dharamshala and 4 personal rooms. There are no restaurants around so either you have to take your own food or you have to eat in the army canteen. In short the temple is must visit if you believe in God .

title: Jaisalmer trip
review: When visiting Jaisalmer this is a must visit not only because of it's historical and religious importance but the ride is just amazing. The clusters of windmill and huge dunes gives u a warm welcome. We went direct instead of going from Ramgarh. The area is very well maintained n u have a small canteen being run by BSF, food options are less bt it's a blessing in disguise.

title: Amazing place
review: The place is really is amazing . a Mata temple which is just with devotional vibes . unbelievable things to see surrounding of temple

title: Must do
review: All a part of the Jaisalmer sojourn. This temple is maintained by the Border Security Force (BSF) and has a small museum inside the temple complex.

title: Must Go
review: This temple is 120 km from Jaisalmer. taking an innova will help and you can reach the place in 2 hours. The best part of the trip is the  landscape and the temple maintained by BSF. A must visit.

title: you will see god magic when you reach this place
review: tannot mata mandir is about 110-120 km away from Jaisalmer city. I travelled by bus which was arranged by YHAI. visit this place only in winter season. strickly not in summer. as every mandir is holy and peace giving place ,also this one. here you can see unblasted bomb dropped by Pakistan airforce.also small museum is there. they dropped hundred of bomb nereby this temple but noone can demage the temple. from that day our army strongly believe in presence of mata . you can enjoy good photography at vijay stambh and armymen.

title: Nice ride from Jaisalmer to Tanut
review: It is nice ride from Jaisalmer to Tanut. Can visit India - Pakistan border at Logewala also.

title: blessed
review: Blessed to visit this place. place is magical and will love to come back here with my family. It was a very relaxing visit.

title: Awesome !!
review: Cant Discribe review.....It was Wonderfull Experience......Aarti (Evening worship) experience is the one of Best In My life....Tample is being taking care By our Respected force...I dont have words for that Experience...Just can Say...Join It And experience It....

title: Trip of adventure, prayer and pride
review: Its about 150KM from the main city. The road trip is very adventurous as the road goes trough desert area. No phone network, no market (except Ramgarh), no facility in between, army bunkers, army veicle the whole trip fill you with thrill. In the way you must see Indira Canal that is miraculous life line of thar.It gets its water from Punjab. When you reach temple you will be filled with pride and bliss bcz its also a victory memorial. The temple is managed by Boarder Security Force of India. You can tie a hanky in the temple for get your wish fulfilled. Purchase a new hanky from prasad shop.I visited the temple with my kids. Everyone enjoyed the trip. Its a lifetime road trip.

title: Nothing special unless u r religious and patriot
review: My heading of review says it all. Its famous since india pak war. It did not get destroyed even after shelling from Pakistan. So its believed its the magical powers of the goddess. I liked the place but it might not interest every  body

title: Well managed
review: its managed by BSF and they have done a good job of keeping it nicely. Was surprised by the number of people that visit it since it is an extreme end of the country.

title: A Goddess with bombs
review: A very holy place to visit near Pakistan border. The Tanot mata saved indian army as well as civilians by bombs trown by Pak army. You can visit Indo-Pak border with prior permission.

title: Divine Temple
review: Oh what a divine feeling.  Everyone to please visit this temple. BSF Jawans maintain this temple so well that surroundings are so clean and neat. Jai Mata Di.

title: Historical temple
review: Location:- located very close to indopak border.very famous temple which has a very brave history during indo pak wars.

title: ARMY IS PURE
review: The Army people protect this fab place. the vibrations are very good. the Journey on roads was gr8 with fab deserts. more beautiful than those of dubai's

title: Seeing is believing
review: This temple is near the Pakistan border managed by BSF. The temple remained unharmed even after heavy firing by Pakistan as non of the bomb exploded. They are on display at the temple. Must visit to see the power of God.

title: Fascinating
review: First thing first, its a simple temple with no novelty to it!

title: Very inspiring
review: You should enjoy the huge Sand Dunes on the way to Tanot mata temple from Jaisalmer. The sand dunes are huge and nice to watch.

title: Dont miss the Aarti
review: Its a long drive from the city, but worth it. On the way to Tanot mata do visit Jaisalmer war museum and Longewala war museum. Both longewala and Tanot mata tell us the brave stories of the soldiers from the Indo Pak war of 1971.

title: Proud to be take
review: It has got its own importance. All army people and nearby people believe in Tanot mata as it saved them during war of 1971. Although surrounded by live bombs it did not got blast in these particular area.

title: Good place
review: Its a good place. This place is 122kms far from jaisalmer. This temple is famous from the time of indo pakistan war. A must visit place.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: Nice to anything related to war, This temple is maintained by BSF, It is 20km far from pakistan border. It is same place where during war of 65 pakistan dropped 3000 bombs, but no harm can be done to temple. Also this temple got mention in Border movie. good nice temple clean and having history.

title: RIDE OF MY LIFETIME
review: When somebody told me it is a powerful temple( not anti national just atheist ;) ) ,I sniggered!! It is located at two hour drive from jaisalmer , I revulsed!! There are no petrol bunks from ramgarh( midpoint bw jaisalmer and tanout temple ), I collapsed! But my friends infectious enthusiasm to see the indo pak border took me to it. And I got a hell of riding experience!! What you MUST do :

title: dont miss to go there
review: what to say about that place . its amazing , awesome , lots of thing you can see and feel that what is the actual happen there in war time . its mesmerizing all the way must say its life time experience i had there .

title: Speechless!!
review: Visited this place just before a downpour of rain..was a chilling experience. Cant describe this feeling in words!

title: peaceful
review: A temple maintained and worshipped by army , nice to see a temple with live bombs undiffused, from the 1971 war, truelly blessed place

title: If you r visiting Jaisalmer - then take out a day for Tanot Mata
review: Tanot Mata Temple is known more for the unexploded bombs during Indo-Pak War than it's ancient history which is more than a 1000 years old. One cannot go beyond the temple area as it's border zone. About 15 kms from the Temple is the Border Post 609. To go there you need permission from DM at Jaisalmer. A reference from friends in Army or BSF will help. It takes about half a day to get this permission, if at all.. The roads are mostly good and one can only see vast barren land and Wind Mills along the 120 km route. An experience not to be missed.

title: JAGRUT MATA TEMPLE
review: this temple is managed and maintained by B.S.F.even Pujari is also a B.S.F. Jawan, nice temple to visit during the trip to Jaisalmer, this is most prime attraction of this city which is 122 k.m. away from jaisalmer, but strongly recommended to visit this temple, during intruding indian border Pakistan had fired to many Bombs, Mortar & Missile to destroyed this temple, but none of them was blast and still said alive Bombs & Mortar Shell has been kept in a show case in  the Temple.

title: Very far from the city
review: The temple is situated 120 kms from jaisalmer.If you want to visit the border please take permissions from Jaisalmer office only.  The border closes at 5 in the evening so start early.

title: Tanot mata mandir
review: A religious place . Army people believe it a lot as it had saved them during 1971 war . The place is very clean & neat & maintained by army people only

title: Excellent place must visit once in life
review: I can not say anything about it. I would say that everyone must visit here and see the power of Tanot mata.

title: Sheild of India
review: Tanot Mata Temple is the presiding goddess for the BSF and all Military Jawans situated near the border. Unexploded arms in the temple tell the story. Very clean temple and well maintained

title: Magical Temple
review: It is believed that during Indo-Pakistan war of 1971, bomb which are dropped by Pakistan in this area were not exploded due to Tanot Mata's small temple at that time. So after that BSF make an trust for it. And at present, it is manged by BSF, very clean, also lunger during naurate. With special permission you can visit Kishangarh (border village). In Kishangarh, you can see ruins of a fort. A must go place for explorer and who wants to know locals! If you are not an Indian, then you can't visit this place. You have to get permission from District Authority.

title: Jai Mata Ki
review: Lot of history and faith. 120km drive from City with good road, wind mills and desert. Carry food and water for the trip. Last place get something to eat will be at Ramgarh.

title: Great Madir
review: This is great mandir. this madir is belong to our proud. army man are care taker of this mandir. Must visit this Mandir

title: Spiritual Attraction
review: It's a temple located around 120km from Jaisalmer.

title: Must Visit Place.
review: This Mandir has unique story attach to it. According to this when Pakistan attach India from Jaiselemer they fired lots of bombs but none of the bomb hit this temple. Even the bombs which fall near by the temple doesn't exploded , but remain unexploded. These unexploded bombs are now kept in the temple as show piece.

title: World Wonder is Tanot Mata Temple
review: I can't say many thing about Mata because this load Mother God but ist awesome I will visit again and again Jai Mata di

title: A ride to the saver...the saver of all...
review: never had such experience of peace and power on the same time...go there and feel and most important is that you will have a best ride of earth too when you will drive from jaisalmer to tanot...wish you luck and blessings of mata ji...

title: Jai Mata Di
review: Visiting the Godess of the Desert set admits the golden sands of thar Tanot Mata is a great place for spiritual seekers. The vibes are very powerful. Feel Great to be here

title: Religion and patriotism symbolize the place
review: This temple is located close to Indo-Pak border and is maintained by BSF. The drive to the place was very good with excellent roads, windmills and sand dunes along the way. There is stretch of 4-5 kms which was under construction, rest of the road was great. Ramgarh has the last petrol station, which is around 60 Kms away, so be sure to fill up the tank. Once you reach a place you feel patriotic and religious. If you need to visit the border then remember to take permission from Jaisalmer

title: God's creation
review: A must visit place maintained by BSF. Must concentrate to the history, detailed by the Panditji. Camera is allowed.

title: religious place.
review: religious place on border maintained by indian army. was bombed by enemy during war but none of those bombs exploded.nice and peaceful place.felt at peace visiting this place.one can also visit the border but you can,t go beyond the temple.

title: Divine and Peaceful
review: Reaffirms faith in supreme, the temple seems to be kept opened throughout the day. There is a separate shrine for Mansa devi.

title: Great for a long drive through the country
review: Many Bollywood films have been shot on the road to Tanot Mata mandir. The road is well laid and metalled. It passes through miles of wilderness, with a hamlet or two dotting the landscape intermittently. Go well stocked as the only "town" where you can get food/ medicines/ loo is about 50kms from Jaisalmer, halfway to the mandir. Interestingly this town also has many roadside shops selling solar panels to run anything from a tube light to fan.

title: Temple maintained and run by the Army
review: Very nice temple. but can get very loud. It is maintained by the army.. Do try to catch the aarthi at 6:30 PM.

title: The Journey is well worth the distance.
review: The road to Tanot Mata Temple is NOT PERFECT, but well worth your time, with lovely sand dunes all along, nice villages and the temple of course. BSF personnel themselves perform aarti at ~6 / 7 pm daily which is pretty energetic. Unexploded bomb shells from the war are also kept on display with expalanations.

title: Good place to visit
review: Great Place where you have seen live bomb which is been used by pakistan army during 1971 war at jaisalmer.

title: A long drive in desert
review: Excellent temple. We visited during our stay.

title: Drive to the Temple- Experience of Thar Dessert!
review: The drive to the temple is 3-4 hours. The road is narrow with almost no other car in sight! The temple is clean and well organized. The temple is only 10 minutes drive away from the Border Post of the Indo- Pak border which makes the destination totally worth a day's time!

title: It is the journey rather than the destination
review: In so much as the temple gave a destination it was the journey that was breathtaking. The real desert is west of Jaisalmer and driving on a two lane road with bare traffic, and straights with troughs and crests, and sand right off the shoulder of the road that the tyres sink into is exhilarating.

title: historical place with faith in devi/mata
review: This temple is very famous after india pakistan war. Here bomb which didnt blast during war is put to show. People say all this bomb didnt blast due to goddess tanot.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: Visited Tanot Mata temple during my recent visit to Jaisalmer. The distance between jaisalmer and the temple is around 120 kms which takes around 1.5 hours of drive. The road condition towards Tanot is excellent.During 1971 war Pakistani army dropped around 450 bombs but there was no harm to this temple. Nowadays BSF takes care of this temple.

title: Drive is awesom
review: The drive from jaisalmer to the temple is very smooth and nice. It gives you the taste of desert. Its proximity to border makes it adventourous. Temple is very nice.

title: Faith brings security
review: The story behind this temple is quite interesting and brings most of the people here looking for the missile shells. Was it poor quality missile or the true power of almighty, no one can ever tell.

title: Army Temple
review: Amazing to see that all our army men are visiting this temple, without any religion connected to it.

title: A sense of Patriotism
review: Knowing the history of the 1970 Indo Pak war, it gives a pride and patriotic feeling by visiting the temple during the time of Arati. The defense personal perform all rituals at the temple. Worth travelling 120 Kms for visiting this temple and Longewala war zone.

title: Powerful
review: Heard the stories of this temple from locals... When really saw live bombs of 1971 war, i was thrilled..

title: Nice
review: Tanot mata temple now under BSF .... Very clean temple and peaceful .Story behind this is also very exciting . Must visit

title: What an experience
review: Your visit to Jaisalmer is incomplete without the trip to Tanot Mata Mandir. What a story & majestic temple. Although I have to admit that there was a hidden agenda of being able to get close to the border, but we were told that only those with 'connects' in BSF are allowed beyond.

title: Jai mata di.
review: Nice holy place.

title: Very nice
review: We went there because we had read so much on the bomb dropping and zero explosions.

title: Last temple of India
review: Blessed to visit this temple located at Indo - Pak border, no lying! if I call it as last Indian temple. Touched by the army men's efforts for keeping its history and vigour alive. We managed to attend its evening Aarti, a stream joy, peacefulness, a pool of spirituality and wherein numerous Indian border men were singing prayers, chanting mantras, playing Dholaka. It all lasted almost for an hour. Further, there is a Islamic mashjid in front of the temple which truly depicts our unity in religions!

title: Drive is beautiful.
review: Worth going to this Mandir the drive is amazing. I would suggest you to go on an SUV. Smooth road but it is 6 hours drive to and fro so start a little early.

title: A trip for the devout
review: Located 125 kms from Jaisalmer, the temple at the tiny border town of Tanot is strictly for the devout. There are few small, unexploded shells within the temple, remnants of the 1971 Indo-Pak war. The drive through the desert is super though. Take time to stop and climb the sand dunes. Recommend to start early (6 am) so as to beat the harsh heat and the constant stream of military vehicles.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: More than the temple, it is thje drive that is amazing. A solitary road going through sandy terrain as far as you can see. The temple is maintained by the BSF and legend has it that in spite of severe bombing by the Pakistan Army, not one shell exploded in the temple. From here a drive to Longewal to see the war museum and the site of the Longewala battle between Indian and Pakistani Armies is worth a visit

title: Memorable trip
review: One of the must visit place.Went on a road trip from South to North. Could feel the tense atmosphere. Later went to BP 609 as well, wow what an adventurous journey...

title: Must visit
review: We went to the temple on 4 Jan'16.There is a story behind the temple that made it truly famous.Around 300 live bombs from pakistan dropped at this site during 1971 indo-pak war but none exploded.There are two roads to reach the temple.The straight road to tanot is good but for a patch of 4-5 km towards the end.The other road, via longowala is excellent and one can also get to see the brilliant longowala yudh sthal enroute.I would recommend the longowala route

title: Nothing Great Except the War stories
review: I personally am not fond of temples and this was no exception. However, this is apparently the saviour deity of the BSF jawans and therefore the temple is managed by the BSF.

title: truly magical
review: heard so much about tanot mata...  but never believed if like this could happen but after visiting the temple oh my god.. every story is real... must visit place, thumbs up.  willing to visit again

title: Temple with Patriotic touch
review: Located about 130 kms from Jaisalmer...quite a ride as the road is not good in some patches. Good scenic views on the way. There is one more temple just 6 kms ahead of Tanot Mata mandir which you can visit as well. Both these temples are very well maintained by BSF.

title: Awesome place to visit
review: The temple is a good visit. there is a grave of a Peer baba inside the temple complex. During the war in 71, apparently bombarding was immense on this temple, but none of the bombs exploded creating a legend.

title: A temple near the border post.
review: We traveled to the temple for dual purpose of visiting the temple as well as the border post. Due to the visit of a high rank official, we were denied to visit the border post, that left us a bit disappointed.

title: Good Road Trip
review: Best drive to view sun rise and sunset. Hundreds of Windmill in surrounding absolutely amazing view.

title: Jai tanot mata
review: Temple was near the border...we attended the aarti which lasted nearly for 2hr... well maintained by BSF...road from Jaisalmer to tanot mata temple and from temple to Longewala is in very good condition...

title: God exists
review: This is most amazing place on earth and must go to see this temple.

title: historical place of mata ji
review: its the same temple shown in boarder temple where the bomb fell but didnt blast... the bomb are still kept here for visitors to see

title: A definite trip to this place if you are going to Tanot
review: This temple is said to have survived without a scratch after huge bombings happened in 1971 war with Pakistan. The Border Security Forces have now built a proper temple there and many throng to this temple to seek blessings of Tanot mata

title: Very Good
review: It is around 120 kms from the main city of Jaisalmer and a few kms from Pakistan Border. The temple is managed and run by BSF. It is a must visit place during trip to JSMR and one will relish visiting the temple and its peaceful atmosphere.

title: Must visit, when in Jaisalmer
review: Tanot mata temple is around 2 hours drive from Jaisalmer. The road is well paved, except a small stretch, which is being improvised. The temple itself is a peaceful place. Bombs and missiles from 1971 indo-pak war are kept in display, legend is that not even a single bomb dropped by pak exploded here.

title: Jai Tanot Mata
review: Historical temple. This temple is close to the border with Pakistan about 120 kms from Jaisalmer. It is close to the battle site of Longewala. It is managed by BSF. It has a museum which houses unexploded bombs dropped by Pakistan. This temple was shown in the movie 'Border'.

title: In the middle of thar
review: It's a worth visit. The temple is in the middle of desert and maintained by BSF. The roads are awesome from Jaisalmer except some places where some work in progress.

title: One of the places to visit around Jaisalmer
review: We went to this temple on bike from Jaisalmer.  It's quite far but the ride is enjoyable when you have a company.

title: Place of Faith and Devotion
review: Place of Faith and Devotion. It is believed that, Tanot Mata, the deity of the Temple protected the Village from the Bombings from Pakistan during 1971 War.

title: Family trip
review: A good place with very good energy.....maintained by BSF. We liked this place almost the border. Do remember to see old devi pratimas next to temple.

title: Tanot mata ki jai
review: Must must must visit. Those who does not believe in GOD and goddess must visit this place. Only than you will believe power of divine being. More than 200 bombs fired by Pakistan but not even one exploded near temple. P.S. 45 km from this place please visit longewala place. Damaged tanks and jeep of Pakistani army captured in war are kept. This is actual place of war. Pleae watch 20min movie of war. Very heart touching. Pleasese visit this place. Don't miss

title: Tanot Mata Mandir
review: This is a must visit place when you happen to visit Jaisalmer.

title: Nice place
review: A nice place about 2 hrs from Jaisalmer. Everyone knows the story, but still if you are in Jaisalmer then surely visit. It's a nice isolated place, and a good drive.

title: Visit Primarily to obtain Divine Blessings...
review: Although the temple is signified more for its miracles of all the bombing activities that proved to be a failure by itself during the war & also for a movie shooting location, but we personally feel that the temple must be visited to obtain divine blessings rather than bearing in mind a curiosity to see few preserved unexploded  original bombs of war times.

title: Energetic place
review: It is one of the place must visit. First drive from Jaisalmer to Tanot is very nice and if you can make it time of Aarti ,will like it very much. Going to Border is different experience but for that need pre permission.

title: Holy place
review: This is a historical place and has its significance due to Indo Pak war. It's 35 mms from Longewala and about 2hrs drive from Jaisalmer. The road from Ramgarh to Tanot is being reconstructed so one gets slowed down.

title: #Tanot Mata Mandir
review: Amazing place to feel d history what happen at dat time...120kms away from jaisalmer a must visit place if u r gng to jaisalmer. I recommend to go by bus to tanot if u want to feel the real rajasthan.

title: Divine Place - " We Remember"
review: Holy Place near to Pakistan border.

title: Very good feel to be there
review: That is not my first time I already been bifore that mata temple I really respect so much tanot mata its really great that see protect jaisalmer from from animy you have to join there arti time its good jai mata je jai tanot rai

title: Nice temple well managed by BSF
review: This is the same temple where the legend says that not even a single bomb exploded despite the fact that 3000 were fired on it. It has been transformed into a beautifully managed temple now with BSF folks all around. If you can somehow managed to take the permission to visit Pakistan border as well than this is a great deal. Nevertheless drive is good and small villages on the way will keep you interested.

title: Legend from 1965 Indo-Pak war
review: The temple is beautifully maintained by BSF - worth a visit to pay homage to the legend - even hundreds of shell could not damage the sacrosanctum.

title: Must visit holy place... very peaceful Mata Ji Mandir with museum..
review: Mata ji mandir is very peaceful and your can feel the positive energy in the premises. Contains live bombs which Pakistan targeted and pics of the war time... a must visit place.. please bring your food with you. Canteen has just tea and biscuit.

title: Must visit.
review: The temple is peaceful and serene and you feel blessed coming here. Close by is longewala which is a must visit after the temple.

title: amazing place
review: loved to hear history about this place and was fun to get there with my friends . i was in jaisalmer for a small trip but it made it worth

title: Great Place
review: A must visit place on your trip to Jaisalmer, but be assured to go to Ghantiwala Temple before this and Longewala Post after this.

title: Border visit must. Arrange for permission beforehand.
review: It is said that 242 bombs were thrown but none of the blasted during 1971 war. Visit to Longewala and border visit is must. For border visit, permission beforehand is must. We could not get the permission on our own but our chauffeur arranged for the permission for us. So we are lucky to visit border.

title: Wonderful Drive And Great Views
review: We thoroughly enjoyed the drive to this place. Although the distance is quite a bit, but we enjoyed every bit of it. Do not miss the Longewala Border of India & Pakistan, which is now in Indian territory. Also, at the border location, there are some PAkistani Tanks which are captured by India. The temple is worth visiting, and the drive to it is thoroughly Rajasthan.

title: Must Visit
review: This is very close to the Indo Pak border. Blessings of Tanot mata on Indian Army. Unexploded missiles are displayed from the 1971 war. Very close to this place is the longewala border which has a war museum which has tanks and missile lauchers displayed. Its a must see place.

title: Trip to Tanot Mata Temple
review: We drove from Vadodara to Tanot and its a very good drive. Altough there were some patch works going on by BRO near Tanot but still their management was so good that there were no traffic hurdles. Scenery wise this place is awesome to visit in colder weather i.e. from the month of Nov to Feb. This really feels like yellow sea of sand and if you dare to climb you can enjoy climbing some of the sand dunes which are locally called as dhore but beware it takes lots of efforts and stamina. Temple is very beautiful and carries a strong history and must say it is very well maintained by BSF personnel. But do carry somethings to eat and water to drink with you because in this drive of 120 Km from Jaisalemer to Tanot there is only one village where you can get decent refreshments, Ramgarh. So carry food and water and enjoy the trip

title: Beautiful drive for blessings
review: The drive from Jaisalmer till the temple is beautiful with sun kissing the sand dunes and welcoming you.The temple is located in the last village before the Indo Pak border and is considered that the Goddesses has blessed India during the war of 1971 and will forever take care of the soldiers posted their. Noone is allowed to go beyond this village without permission, so if you are planning to see the border make sure you have the permission in your hand. Teh permission is to be taken from Jaisalmer itself.

title: shrine for all patriotic guys.
review: its great experience going there. its better to go in morning or evening Aarti time n see the magic. you will really enjoy it. ur goosebumps will tell the story why this place is called shakti peeth. BSF maintained it very well  and very co operative to pilgrims as well as tourists. longewala and kishangarh border (INDO-PAK BORDER) is nearer. but u have to take permission either from BSF staying in Ramgarh town ( on the way to Tanot temple i.e.  center point from jaisalmer to Tanot.) . you can see the bombs used in indo-pak war. people make their wish and it is believed that it comes true. its my personal experience too. enjoy

title: Tanot mata
review: Tanot mata temple ..its story n reality will touch evryones heart with pride. Tanot mata temple along with longewala (border area)  is a great experience. Longewala while enrouting towards tanot mata is around 25 kms from ramgadh. You can also choose to visit longewala while coming back towards jaisalmer however it will increase the distance but worth. The sceneric view is superb.

title: Amazing drive
review: I was taken by a surprise looking at the good roads condition during my Rajasthan trip. I drove from Jaisalmer in my car to Tanot and entire stretch was awesome with a different landscape. About 30km road is under construction apart from that you can cruise through entire stretch. The temple is managed by BSF javans itself. 15km from Tanot temple there is Ind-Pak border. You need to get prior permission from BSF to get there. We got permission from BSF and drove to the border. This was like icing on the cake for me :).

title: must go
review: very nice must go .very nice mandir and incomplt journy without going in mandir . must go n see history

title: Spiritual Place
review: Temple and pakistan border area worth to visit for both religious people and tourists. The temple with remarkable story  during war time.. Must visit place

title: MILITTRY ATTRACTION
review: Darashana of TANOT MATA, BUT SUPER ATTRACTION OF JAISALMER TO TANOT ROAD SIDE VIEW.

title: Nothing outstanding, Aarti was a disappointment
review: We took a swift desire which costed us 2200 after some negotiation. The driver was ready to take us to Bada bagh as well but we kept it for next day. It takes 2 hrs to reach primarily because a patch of 25km is under construction otherwise road is superb two lane.

title: Maa ka aashirwad , Desh bhakti k saath
review: Actually feel blessings of Tanot mata on Indian Army when we see unexploded missiles in show case.

title: must visit place
review: this place is indo pak border.here locals told me that a bomb was thrown here but  it was not exploded during war time.it is one of important place to visit around jaisalmer. from jaisalmer to tanot approx 90km.

title: Great place.
review: We visited this place in Apr. There is a mata Tanot's temple. One can find so many artillery shells inside tje temple as the history says Pakistan fired hundreds of shells in 1971 but with the powe of mata ji not even a single shell exploded. One finds mental peace here. Being maintained by Border Security Force.

title: very pious
review: positive vibes are all over the place and an aura of mata tanot seems to be there. People should visit this temple if they have a chance to come to jaisalmer

title: One should visit
review: This is very close to the Indo Pak border. Blessings of Tanot mata on Indian Army. Unexploded missiles are displayed from the 1971 war. Very close to this place is the longewala border which has a war museum which has tanks and missile lauchers displayed. Its a must see place.

title: A popular temple of Thar desert
review: This is an old and popular temple of "Goddess Tanot" near Indo-Pakistan border area of Rajasthan.The temple is well maintained by Border Security Force(BSF).Evening Arti is very special.Es specially during Navratri festival days,lot of devotees visit this temple.The area is also known for its natural gas reserves.

title: Temple with rich history and maintained by BSF
review: Tanot Mata temple is towards the pakistan border side. This temple has lots of stories attached to it. As per one story,  even bombs could not destroy this temple during Pakistan War , however the structure in immediate vicinity were completely destroyed.  From here one can also get permission from BSF to visit the LOC which is another 5-6 KMs from the temple.

title: Feel the god
review: The visit to this place was great

title: Not a Pilgrimage
review: One of the highlights of Jaisalmer trip, but not on religious grounds. The temple itself is a small one and had gained fame among the BSF and Army men after the Indo Pak war of 1965 when allegedly a thousand shells fired by Pak army failed to explode. But the drive through the desert is what makes it worth a visit. An early morning drive via the Longewal border post is picturesque and one of its kind. There is very little sign of habitation and even lesser signs of vegetation. A small war museum has been opened since August 2015 at Longewal post and is on similar lines to the one on the Jodhpur-Jaisalmer highway, albeit on a smaller scale.

title: "JAI MATA DI"-TANOT MATA TEMPLE
review: it is almost 130 km from the jaisalmer railway station ..you can take cab from station .on average cab will charge around 10-11 rs per km . temple is maintained by BSF .it has war history . live bomb which are keep in temple which failed to explode-Indo Pak war of 1965 .it can be one day trip you can first visit  Longewal border post -bada bagh etc

title: All right - not really worth the trouble
review: Its just another temple. Period. Nothing spectacular about it- so unless one has religious fervour or finds the idea of visiting a temple run by the BSF very close to the Pak border an appealing one, its not really worth the trouble of going all the way there.

title: Superb and fantastic - A must for patriotic Indians
review: Tanot Mata Temple is famous for the 1971 war. The Mata using her powers stopped the bombs falling on the temple from Pakistan. There are a few un exploded bombs still lying there. Permission for entering has to be taken from the Military Establishment. The place is 150 kms from Jaisalmer. If you are going by your own car then ensure that the fuel tank is full and you carry sufficient foodstuff and water.

title: A temple testimony to war
review: well, basically a temple as with other border areas. the legend goes that bombs dropped by pakis did not explode in the temple and thats how it became famous as a tourist spot. what I liked is the drive to the temple through miles and miles of sand. One tends to become nostalgic looking at our soliders posted there, giving their all to protect us. Also coming from the south of India, I admired my beautiful country with such varied landscapes.

title: Jaisalmer Trip - September 2015
review: I am sure most of you have seen the Bollywood Movie “Border” where in there is a temple shown in the Laungewala Post where BSF offers Pooja on a daily basis.

title: Testimony of the divine
review: Made famous by the reference in a popular Bollywood movie, the Tanot mata temple is standing testimony to divine forces. Currently maintained by the armed forces, this temple has a display of unexploded shells from a previously fought war. People attribute the fact that over 450 shells fell in its vicinity and not a scratch came to the temple - to the power of the deity. The drive from Jaisalmer to the temple is fantastic. The roads and mostly in excellent shape. This place is a must visit to anyone who is on a trip to Jaisalmer.

title: Well maintained Temple. Journey from Jaisalmer is awesome.
review: Tanot Mata temple is maintained by BSF and thus it is very clean and well maintained unlike most other temples in India. The journey from Jaisalmer was very good with lonely roads and several sand dunes. There is a place available to stay in Tanot and it is also maintained by BSF. There is an ICICI bank ATM too.

title: Gems in desert
review: IF you are in jaisalmer then you sure visit this place , its spiritual and nice view of thar desert.

title: Worth the Ride from Jaisalmer - You get to see the real desert in this route
review: 120 kms from Jaisalmer, this temple is maintained by the BSF(Border Securiy Force) and the legend of the 1971 non-exploded bomb is fascinating. It's a great drive from Jaisalmer and doable in half a day. If you manage to get permission from the BSF at Jaisalmer city, you could get a chance to visit the border(Ind-Pak) - 30 kms from the temple. We weren't lucky! :(

title: Amazing place and route
review: It is an amazing place, I would recommend to take permission from Jodhpur and Jaisalmer for border visit and reach the temple before 4 p.m. to visit the border. Also, please do attend the evening arti at the temple which is being done by BSF people and is mesmerizing.

title: Faith .. on the borders
review: The locals believe in the power of Tanot Mata and some strongly believe in making a trip to Tanot Mata is auspicious, since it houses/showcases the non-exploded bombs collected during the border war. This temple is on the borders, maintained by the BSF.

title: "worth a visit "
review: this temple should be on your must visit list. The temple is quite old and the architecture is beautiful. You need to go though over a hundred stairs to each the main temple. The main temple is surrounded by many other smaller temples. Overall love the architecture of this temple.

title: a jagrut devasthan
review: on hearing the story of the temple one gets mesmerized, for those NASTIKS a visit to this temple is a must to learn the power of GOD, no science can explain the reasons for the happenings oover here

title: Temple of Faith - Tanot Mata
review: Famous for the Miracle of Goddes Durga at this place.

title: is a excellent temple
review: bsf takes care of this temple it is said that this temple fullfills  the need of people n 24 hours langar is been provided ,is near to longewala

title: Must visit!
review: This is while going to the Longewala post in Jaisalmer. The temple is unique and interesting because nothing happened to this temple when there was a war between India and Pakistan. The bombs didn't exploded in the temple premises. The unexploded bombs were kept in the temple and which is really interesting to see.

title: A TEMPLE PART OF MILITARY HISTORY
review: This unique Temple is part of folklore and War history. It is managed efficiently by the BSF. It has inside unexploded bombs form the 1971 war which did not explode as it fell on the Temple. They are still there inside a glass case.

title: The indestructible Temple
review: It is said that during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965, Pakistani Army dropped several bombs targeting the temple but none of the bombs could fall on the temple and large number of the bombs in the vicinity of the temple did not explode. After the war the temple management was handed over to Border Security Force of India. On date Border Security Force Jawans man the temple. The temple has a museum which has collections of the unexploded bombs dropped by Pakistan. As per Indian Census, The Population of Tanot Village is 492 Persons having 49 Household.[3] The place is close to the Pakistan border, an infertile land, and is prone to enemy attacks. Roads are a bit broken but the renovation work is in progress

title: Religion and patriotisim
review: The temple is simply very exciting. The drive to Tanot Mata Temple from Jaisalmer is quite nice with windmills giving you company throughout. Even the RANO village which is probably the only village on the dunes is very charming and mystic. You will see much cleaner and bigger dunes while driving to Tanot.

title: Tanot Mata
review: very old temple...people have trust in this godes & their belief is MATA is still alive there & she will help all the way to them in all the circumstances...

title: Hats off to army boys' excellence
review: Apart from being the temple where no bomb has till now blown off, the temple is a must visit to hear the mornings' and evenings' first aarti which is done by army boys. When we went there, we were in for a surprise. What we initially thought was a recorded aarti was a rendition by army people and simply unbelievable. A live performance which stands out on every count.  A must visit.

title: Mesmerizing Journey in to the Derest
review: We visited Jaisalmer in January.we went there by own car and it was a life time experience we had on the way to temple.both side desert,sand dunes and scattered village only.no human we found on the way.

title: A must do...
review: This is superb even if religion is not on your agenda. The drive from jaisalmer is great. You can see a lot of Army activities and feel friendliness when you talk to them.

title: The Real Force on Border
review: This temple is really unique...first of its type which is maintained by the Border Security force of India...Such Powerful vibrations here that you feel safe within the temple compund...That's the reason that when it was attacked in 1965 by the enemies...the bombs fail to explode here and those are preserved..

title: Visit to Tanot temple
review: Nice experience to visit this temple near the border and maintained by BSF. A must visit on your stay in Jaisalmer.

title: History and miracles...
review: Saw how shells hurled by rival army did not explode in vicinity of shrine. Unique feature is priest is an army jawan

title: Border Town
review: Here lies a border town between India and Pakistan. Tanot is so secluded I couldn't even get Bharti Airtel 3G reception until 40km south.

title: Its not just the temple, its the journey
review: Great experience visiting this place, I may add most unique experience of my life. Driving thru the desert, with hardly any vehicles passing by, with miles and miles of sand next to you, and to see the brave Indian Army and BSF men who guard you in these tough conditions, is a privilege.

title: Now thats a religion
review: Visited here as the temple allows Christians too. Now this isn't just a Hindu temple but a temple with missiles inside its complex. our guide told that the temple came across Indo-Pak 2nd war and everything was destroyed but now this temple, like bullets were dogged...

title: amazing drive a must do for travellers
review: the road to the temple curves through the tribal villages and desserts and gives a different insight into india

title: Real miracle temple near border...must visit
review: Remember movie "border". ...they were talking about godess temple ....this is it guys .....must see real Devine place.

title: Close to Longewala Battle ground
review: The temple is close to the site of Longewala battle which India won. The shrine has photographs of battle scenes. A neat and clean well mantained mandir.

title: Temple near the Pak border
review: Highly revered temple by the people around and above all the services personnel. The priests are also from the services, by turn and the temple is maintained by them. As the temple is near the Pak border, in the last war, many of the surrounding were smashed by the shelling but the Temple was not damaged at all. They have displayed a unexploded shell also.

title: Excellent place
review: Very nice drive through the desert. The temple was well maintained by BSF probably. Dont miss the Longewala post on the way, its worth the trip. But try to avoid mid day travels, as it gets really hot!!

title: Faith at its best
review: History itself is worth of visiting it. Just visit the temple and learn of Indian War with the enemies and history of how temple servived in the middle of War.

title: Best road trip
review: A memorial of power of god.. you can enjoy all the journey.. road is very beautiful  along desert and a village in between desert is really a eye catching

title: Divine place
review: 1971 war was near this temple and it is said that not a single bomb exploded in the temple area. Bombs displayed are proof of the same.

title: jaisalmer
review: it is the oldest places in jaisalmer, also this temple is also important to indian army as this temple remain untouched during the war 1971.

title: great temple.
review: we were group of frnds. Planned for Jaiselmer and then we planned for tanot temple. I believe in this temple and tanot mata. really history and evidence of tanot mata power.

title: Amazing place.
review: Really amazing temple, really great wonder to see all the grenades and bombs didnt work in the temple area due to blessings of Mata on INDIAN ARMY, really good place, totally managed by Indian Army.

title: Divine and Historical...
review: remind me of Border movie...you will find inactive shells and mini rocket components...from jaiselmar it takes nearly 2 hours...road is very good...you will find lot of Suzlon windmills on thr way...

title: Tanot Mata protects the Indian Borders
review: During my trip to Jaisalmer in June 2015, I happened to visit Tanot Mata temple which is around 2 hours from Jaisalmer city. The area completely protected by the Indian army lies on the India Pakistan Border.

title: Miracle Matta Tannot Temple.
review: During my trip to jaisalmer just seven days before i went to Tanot Mata temple which is 120 km from Jaisalmer & 145 km from club mahindra Jaisalmer.It takes 2 hours to reach there if u go nonstop. There is only one small restaurant,& rest rooms for visitors without any charges.The temple is small but well maintained by the army people.Really good place to visit  which should not be missed.This Temple is in the western state of Rajasthan in the Jaisalmer district.The village is close to the border with pakistan & is very close to the battle site of Longewala of the indo- pakistani war of 1971.

title: Must visit the divine temple
review: No words to describe the divine place of mata rani.  Actually its so well maintained by army.  The museum is also must see in the temple it self.  The war museum.  And you will come to know the holy power of goddess tannot mata.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: 120 kms. from Jaisalmer. Historical Temple. Must go with your friends & family. It will required 01 more night in Jaisalmer to visit this memorable place.

title: Great Place
review: Its a nice temple, located 120KM from Jaisalmer. It is maintained by BSF.

title: Road trip from Jaisalmer to Tanot mata temple
review: one of the best route for road trip.

title: GODESS WHO SHIELDS
review: TANOT MATA temple is located 125 kms from jaisalmer.With seeing this place,jaisalmer trip is unfinished.Driving through sand dunes is unforgettable experience.Tanot matha who protected our land in 1972 war. one can see live bomb shells kept at temple.

title: Temple on border
review: Tanot mata temple is about 100+km from Jaisalmer, a road trip to this temple will allow you to enjoy true charm of desert, it can be a great road trip with one of the best roads in India (army maintains these roads). This is probably of a very few temples in India which is handled and maintained by army. One can add a trip to Longewala border if interested which is about 30km away from this place. Battle of Longewala is one of the famous battle in Indian army's history and it is worth visiting this place.

title: A place for spiritual abode at Ind-Pak  border
review: we planned this trip at the spur of the moment after being inspired from an indian movie and the trip was certainly not a disappointment.

title: “Great Place”
review: Its a nice temple, located 120KM from Jaisalmer. It is maintained by BSF. Please note that if you desire to visit the border (BP 609), actually permission is granted at DIG office BSF at Jaisalmer. Its a letter with a stamp. People are confused where to take the permission.

title: A well kept temple
review: We drove from Jaisalmer to Tanot for the experience of driving through the desert. The drive past awesome sand dunes was superb.At the end of the drive we were at Tanot mata temple which is surely one of the cleanest and well kept temples. The surroundings are serene .

title: Half day trip from Jaisalmer
review: A small temple near the border hence a big draw for the army and border security force personnel.  Quiet location with some good sand dunes.

title: Jai Tanot Mata
review: Simply blissful! We left Jaisalmer at 4.30am to be able to attend to the Aarti at 6am. We touched the temple of 'Ghantaewali Mata' - she is considered to be Tanot mata's younger sister. The aarti was soooo peaceful and instantly energising. We then left for Tanot mata's temple. The entire experience was simply overwhelming!!! It was almost as if Mata rani had called us there to be a part of her august aarti. We had our first cuppa cardamom tea with matthi's and balushai's and were enriched. During India-Pakistan war this entire region was heavily shelled and thanks to Mata Tanot's protective cover that out of the 450 bombs that dropped in the temple premises - not one of them exploded. In the entire vicinity there were 3000 such bombs that justs did not explode....Jai Mata Di!

title: A must go place
review: If you are going till Jaisalmer and if you don't  visit Tanot Mata Mandir, you are missing something.

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: this is one temple at the last point of visit to any civilian at this border town...this is apprx 2hrs+ drive from Jaisamler...if u wanna go beyond this point u need to take prior army permission from camp office at Jaisalmer. this temple is maintained by army and pooja is also done by army...

title: Great Desert Drive
review: One can enjoy the beauty of desert with sand dews on both the side. Apart from pilgrimage, every stone of the area speaks live history of our  National Glory and heroic act of our Army

title: Once to Travel !
review: The ROad from Jaisalmer to Tanot Temple is most fascinating. The Tower heights Sand Dunes and the DIstant Villages makes the journey mesmerizing. The distance is only 50kms but you will remember the road.

title: Gods presence at Pakistan Border
review: its worth to visit  I like it very much as during the war it sustained all Pakistan ammunition which proves that God is taking care

title: great art works
review: the place is really good.. so is the art work... nothing wlse to speak of it.. they claimed it was the oldest hindu temple, found it hard to beilieve..

title: Nice place.
review: Its a nice place to visit as it hosts few live bombs from the war and good photographic memories, Be sure to get prior permissions from Jaisalmer if you want to see the border, which we missed.

title: Jai tanot mata
review: Tanot mata temple dedicated to goddess. Tanot is located at a distance of 115km from jaisalmer with the Pakistan border a 20 kms away. The temple is revered by generations of Bhati rajputs and people of people of jaisalmer and surrounding area.

title: An amazing feeling
review: The famous 'Border' movie temple. You get an amazing feeling visiting this place not just for the temple but coz of the history attached! The place is managed by army and they have done a wonderful job in maintaining the place. Its only 20kms from India Pak border and a must visit.

title: Divine Temple: Well Maintained by BSF
review: This temple is situated at about 120 kms from Jaisalmer. Tourists throng to this holy place for offering prayers and tying wish knots by using their handkerchief. They return to untie the knot whenever their wishes are fulfilled by the divine deity.

title: Must visit temple
review: Located in the border, a very famous and respected temple in Rajasthan. Visit this holy temple to get blessings of Mata.

title: End of India
review: This shud be visited by all tourists. This is the actual place where the war shown in the film Border happened. Actually the mortar shells which were bombed by Pak army didn't diffused here because of the presence of Tanot Mata. Enroute Tanot, you will find a dessert village Rohru which looks exceptionally beautiful from a distance. While coming back don't take this conventional route to Jaisalmer but instead go to Sadewala -- Longewala -- Ghotru -- Jaisalmer. You will love to see our borders with Pak and love to listen to the war stories from the Army Jawans typically like the poisoning of the well at Longewala so Pak army will drink water and die there itself. The dessert looks beautiful on this route with small villages in it. But your vehical shud be in excellent condition and tyres shud not trouble as there is no assistance on this route. Carry your own food Items and ample water

title: Intersesting place
review: If you wish to visit BP 609, please collect permission from BSF headquarters just outside Jaisalmer city. We could not visit BP 609 because we thought we would get permission from tanot mata temple. It costed us rs. 4000 to visit tanot mata + longewala border from Jaisalmer in an innova. we were a group of 6. Its a 7 hour drive from jaisalmer and back.

title: Magnificent Mataji Magic....
review: The place has unique ambiance of Patriotism & Worship together. Every day aarti done by JAWANS is one of the awesome thing to listen and proud to be part of that. Please get your documentation done prior so  you can get chance to go further this temple.

title: Beautiful!
review: Loved it! Must visit if you go to Jaisalmer. The place is 20 kms from the Pakistani border and is maintained by the BSF. There is an unmistakable feeling of sanctity.

title: truly divine
review: This place proves that the defence bsf people should be saluted by all of us.

title: Tanot mata mandir
review: It is at the Pakistan boarder. Stories attached with Indo-Pak wars.

title: Real dessert
review: Though we had our own 4x4 vehicle, but since we had not obtained permission in advance from army, we could not go beyond the temple towards the border. However, we on our way back went off the beaten track, had chai with the army personnel, climbed up the watch tower.

title: Remember Border the movie
review: I liked the route .. roads and yes the temple !I liked the route .. roads and yes the temple !I liked the route .. roads and yes the temple !

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: Maintained and secured by the Border Security Force, the Tanot Mata temple is barely 25 kms from the international border. It is said that the temple has been miraculously left unharmed by enemy bombings & shellings and that's why it's revered by the BSF and the locals as a 'Jagrat' (Awakened) temple.

title: Perfect end to a long and wonderful drive through the deserted desert :)
review: Never Miss place..

title: Very good road trip from Jaisalmer
review: This temple is 100+ kms from Jaisalmer. If you are not going for religious reasons, then you must visit it for the great drive to this place. It is quintessential Rajasthan, with big dunes, villages and cattle everywhere. This is one of the best drives you will ever take. At the temple, there is some urban legend about bombs not exploding etc but I am not sure of the authenticity of such claims.

title: Real Desert Experience..Highlight of the trip
review: Much have been said of history and significance of Tanot Mata temple. No doubt it is a religious place but would like to tell all tourists, if you want to experience real desert and wilderness of Thar Desert, do visit this place. It's not about only the place but the terrain of 120 kms, the distance between Jaisalmer and Tanot mata. Hugh sand dunes on both side of the road, in some places miles of sand and typical desert shrubs. Do stop at the mid way at a village called RANAOU (ur driver will be aware). It has miles of very nice, clean and untouched sand dunes without any tourists n camels adjacent to the road. We spend around 30 minutes on the sand dunes clicking photos n enjoying the place. From the temple then head to Longewala. We came across only two tourist vehicles in the entire journey. The entire trip took around 7-8 hours but was really worth Desert experience was far better than SAM sand dunes

title: Jai Mata Di
review: BSF are maintaining properly.Its near to border but BSF are maintaining the temple plastic free in a eco-friendly temple.

title: Jai Devi Maa
review: Temple is very well maintained by BSF. Just a small gesture to repay all that Goddess has given them. Interesting story around this temple. Battle of Longewal & movie BORDER is this temple only.

title: NICE TEMPLE
review: It is a nice temple with the history of the past.Good darshan nicely managed. Clean surrounding . there is mansadevis temple just behind tannot matas temple.The roads leading to tannot from jaiselmer is superb.

title: feel of patriotism and spirituality
review: nice place to visit. to see all bombs targeted by pakistan's side.

title: Amazingly Fantastic Roads !!
review: Must visit Tanot Temple on your visit to Jaisalmer.

title: All Indians must visit
review: Please visit this temple.........truly historical, pakistan border only 15 kms however you need prior approval for that, really wonderful experience.

title: Shri Tanot Mata Temple
review: Must visit place in Jaisalmer. 120 Kms. from Jaisalmer city near Border area. added 01 more night in Jaisalmer to visit this place. in between don't forget to visit "Ghantayali Devi Temple" near Tanot Mata Temple.

title: Religion and Country love combined
review: We visited Tanot Mata temple on our visit to Jaisalmer early last year. Hired a jeep from where we were staying in Jaisalmer, its a one hour drive among sand dunes. We got the see the unexploded bomb shells. The temple is well preserved and army is deployed for security because of its closeness to border.

title: great drive must go 120 kms
review: please dont miss tanot mata temple drive . Wonderful road, great sand dunes and wind mills in between. Temple is very clean well maintained by bsf.

title: A Must visit to Tanot Mata Temple by every Indian
