review: We visited Tanot Mata Temple on the tast day of the year --31st Dec. It was a Devine experience. The unexploded Shells of the Paki's are displayed there in the temple. Visit to Jaisalmer witrhout visiting Tanot Mata Temple is incomplete. !   Also the Border is just few kms away from the temple

title: one of the main attractions of jaisalmer,reverred temple of the area
review: distant from jaisalmer,must have your own arrangement like taxi,car.Local public transport not frequent

title: Tanot Mata temple...a must go
review: This temple is situated near to Pakistan border and maintained by BSF. Even pandit ji is from BSF. Its a small temple but the main point is its journey from city. During travel of 120 Kms in less than 2 hrs is awesome. No traffic, No traffic police, No Red light...non stop ride. There is no public transport available so the only option is either personal car or hire taxi which costs around 3K. First time ever I saw kms of flat land, with no sign of human being, no trees nothing, no cattle's, which is very unique, hard to imagine life that's what Rajasthan is famous for. So don't miss it if you ever go to Jaisalmer.

title: Tanot Mata darshasn was excellent
review: We feel very good when we listen about Tanot Mata Mandir about saved  India / Indian Soldiers during 1965 Ind-Pak war.  Site view  of windmill during journey from Jaisalmer was excellent feeling.

title: Tanot Mata
review: Tanot Mata temple 125 Km from jaisalmer city,  Apart from the darshan of the mesmerizing idol of the Mata

title: A must visit
review: Tanot Temple, dedicated to goddess Tanot is located at a distance of 115 Km from Jaisalmer with the Pakistan border a few kms away.

title: A patriotic place
review: It was a place which is totally managed by Border Security Force(BSF). They have a belief that the goddess have given them blessings which have helped them in winning different wars. Even in movie Border, it was highlighted;-)

title: Nice & Clean temple
review: Famous for its Shelling in 1971 we went to see the temple & it was one of the most cleanest temples i have ever seen as it it maintained by Army.. though not much to eat out there so please do carry some thing to eat with you

title: Great Temple and spiritual place
review: Temple is situated approx 120 Km from jaisalmer city and administrated by army.

title: Miracle
review: Went to India_pakistan border 25kms from the temple had a great experience and also to the BSF camp had a life time experience with the BSF Commandos.

title: Drive from Jaisalmer to Tanot was awesome
review: It's a temple owned and operated by BSF. Tanot is the last village before Indo-Pak boarder.  The road from Jaisalmer to Tanot is awesome.  It takes around 2 hrs to reach Tanot from Jaisalmer. This is really good road right through the desert.  One can view the vastness of the Thor and sands.

title: Good Experience !
review: The temple is 120 km away from Jaisalmer and appox 15km away from India Pakistan border. The road till the temple is covered by vast Thar desert on both sides. So you will enjoy the wilderness of the desert during the Journey. The temple was good and it's history was amazing to listen to.

title: May the Goddess always protect Bharat
review: This temple is a must visit if one comes as far as Jaisalmer. The unexploded and diffused bombs are a must see to reinforce ones faith in the almighty.

title: MUST VISIT
review: Visit it for blessings. Visit it to boost the confidence of our BSF. The road is fantastic, you may chance on to see gazzells as we did.

title: The Powerful Tanot mata
review: Tanot is a village about 120 kms from Jaisalmer, the road to Tanot from Jaisalmer is wonderful, going through Ramgarh, Ranaut it takes around 90 mins by car.. there is a lime stone factory near Ramgarh, once you cross this place hardly you can find vehicles, you can enjoy the high clean sand dunes at Ranaut abt 30 kms before reaching Tanot.. The temple is war memorial and is said that during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965, Pakistani Army dropped several bombs targeting the temple but none of the bombs could fall on the temple and large number of the bombs in the vicinity of the temple did not explode. After the war the temple management is taken care by Border Security Force, from here the Indo Pak border is 20 kms and you need special permission for it from BSF post in Jaisalmer.. temple also has display of few unexploded bombs..

title: Worthwhile experience
review: Go for it if you are in Jaisalmer! It is a good experience. you will get the feel of real Registhan on the drive. Move on to Longewala from here.

title: Tanot Mata Temple with Indian Army
review: Jaisalmer - Tanot Mata road is fantastic you can see lot windmill near buy;  Lot of Locations for Landscape photography,  and then best is Tanot Mata mandir which handle by Indian Army

title: Famous temple
review: The best temple in jaisalmer.  Its is very famus tonot  temple in jaisalmer . Its far from jaisalmer. Must go tanot temple .

title: Absolutely different experience
review: This p,ace is almost 120 kmart from the jaisalmer city. But it s absolutely worth visiting.. The drive is amazing through the desert, very picturesque.

title: Our Religious Palace
review: Tanot Mata Mandir situated near border of India. Soldier of Indian Army are very helpful for traveler and Manage Temple Very Beautifully.

title: Tanot Mata
review: It was 120 km from Jaisalmer but road is good. We enjoyed the trip to this historic temple. We like the temple.

title: Thrilling visit !
review: Can one imagine 3000 bombs were dropped around this place during Indo-Pak war and the temple escaped unscratched ! Apart from the darshan of the mesmerizing idol of the Mata, you get to see some of the unexploded bombs and also read about the unique history of the temple.

title: Jai Hind
review: Fantastic experience, all Indians do visit to feel the experience on the last road of our country. See the real desert, desert life. Don't expect great sand dunes but you can expect vast desert with shrubs, beautiful villages with people without access to basic amenities, but are contentful with their lives...

title: Tanot Mata Temple
review: I liked the desert route. Serene calmness of Ghuntiyali Devi temple and Tanot Mata Temple.

title: Well Maintained historic temple
review: Very well maintained and historic temple. Good craftsmanship and nakkashi done all over.

title: Gods own abode
review: History has it that Pakistan shelled around this temple and none of the bombs exploded, these live bombs are displayed at the temple in a showcase. place is just 20 km before indo pak border it is a 125 km apprx. 2 hr journey 1 way from jaisalmer to this temple but the route is very scenic if you wanna see and feel desert must visit... no restaurants in entire route so carry your nick nacks etc...

title: Tanot Mata No Mandir
review: The temple is approx 130 kilometres from the City of Jaisalmer, and it takes approximately two hours to reach by road. Tanot village is named after the goddess Tanot.

title: Excellent Temple on Border
review: Explore the desert. Unique spot near Indo-Pak border.

title: A very memorable drive
review: The drive of 122km from hotel to the mandir was one of the best drive with breathtaking view of desert and dunes. The place is so beautiful in a quite environment. a must visit place if you visit Jaisalmer

title: Nice Temple in border area.
review: Its a good temple near border area. people can take a permit to visit border at tanot temple from Jaisalmer city office of BSF.

title: Far - Takes your day
review: Like 2 hours 45 min from Jaisalmer....recommend to start early... and take all your food stuff with yourself....can't find any good food eatery or facilities on way.....roads very well maintained by Border Road Organisation (BRO).....only mobile network that works is BSNL.....

title: Be a Proud Indian...!
review: Well, I'll keep it simple.. If you are an Indian, you must visit this place at least once in your life.

title: a journey to heaven
review: we went to see the Tanot Mata Temple which is 120 kilometres away from Jaisalmer City. The temple is very important because of its location and the political history between India and Pakistan. The travellers will surely enjoy the journey by cars that would pass through the desert for about two hours. The scenic beauty on both side of the road to Tanot is wonderful. The lucky ones may enjoy deers playing the natural shrubs on both side of the road in the marusthali.

title: Must visit place ..
review: We visit Tanot Mata Temple. Good Temple 125 Km. from Jaisalmer City near India - Pakistan Border. Temple has history that during war of 1965, non blasted bombs in Temple.

title: Pleasing and calm
review: This temple is located around 120 KM from Jaisalmer,via Ramgarh.It takes exact 2 hrs by road.The temple is well maintained by BSF and has a history to it.Its said that in early 60s war with Pakistan,there was a lot of bomb shelling on it but it remained intact.Thats greatness of Tanot mata for the disciples.

title: Temple near indo pak border
review: Tanot mata temple lies on indo pak border in rajasthan and it has been shown in border movie tooo !! Must visit as its taken care by border security force !!

title: so nice place
review: every thing good only network is not proper and pakistan border also we visit this only 20 kmtrs from the temple

title: Must visit - the fragrance of Jaisalmer trip
review: Tanot mata temple and the Indo-Pak border from Tanot Mata are must visit for anyone to get real feel of the Thar desert. The dunes that the desert safari organisers show are nothing in comparison to the vastness and barrenness you can experience at Tanot mata and on the journey to it.

title: A must visit for every Indian
review: Ok fellas, this is the Temple which is shown in Border movie. And yes even today they have the bombs on display which fell on this temple but did not explode :)

title: Must visit to have feel of real desert
review: We went to Tanot Mata Temple during navratri and the place was crowded. However, crowd management and overall management of the temple by BSF was excellent. During Arati, we met a retired Assistant Commanent of BSF and an old villager, who had survived Pakistani bombing in 1965. We noticed many shops selling eatables and bottled water outside the temple; however, not sure whether these shops are there during the remaining part of the year.

title: The temple with unexploded Bombs
review: Quiet a good place,some 120 kms from Jaisalmer on LOC, good experience we had permission to visit LOC, Longewala. This Place is not for foreign tourist.

title: ''AMAZING EXPERIENCE''
review: Brilliant!Visited tanot then we visited deodra where movie BORDER shooted and saw some Pakistan tanks BSF area,,it was good

title: A nice temple with war history
review: On 11th of October 2014, we went to see the Tanot Mata Temple which is 120 kilometres away from Jaisalmer City. The temple is very important because of its location and the political history between India and Pakistan. The travellers will surely enjoy the journey by cars that would pass through the desert for about two hours. The scenic beauty on both side of the road to Tanot is ownderful. The lucky ones may enjoy deers playing the natural shrubs on both side of the road in the marusthali.

title: Tanot Mata Mandir
review: If you can spend an extra day in your tour programme then definitely visit this temple,  the last mile before border. Also on your way back enjoy Longewal hardly 15km away from this place

title: Temple Manage by BSF
review: 120 km from jesalmer. Border is just 15 km away from it. It requires permission to visit border.

title: Super Natural.
review: It was very good exp. as Come to know What are the powers of our God and what the God can do.

title: Exciting
review: its about 2 hours scenic drive from jaisalmer and its a quite enjoyable long drive. Suggest browse before going there to appreciate this place as it is all about Indo-Pakistan war in 60's/70s. Seeing unexploded bombshells is surely exciting whether you believe the story of mata ji protecting the place despite repeated enemy attack or see this a faulty war efforts of the enemy.

title: mother of Indian soldier
review: A temple surround by dessert is located at 15km from the line of control between India and Pakisthan. It is said that when Pakisthani army throw bombs when the bomb which fall down in temple was never explode and they are still in temple museum. in same condition. they way to tanot mata temple was very nice that you could not find any person and shop on the road, just sand slopes and some sheep.  when you think no one is here  at the same time you saw a small village with no lights.

title: Extraordinary Experience
review: A very different temple in every way. Given its history and the fact that it is managed by the BSF (including the priests) touches upon the patriotism of every visitor. The aarati is performed by the jawans for almost an hour and brings out divine feelings. The place is kept very clean and the BSF personnel are very helpful. One must not miss the aarati that is performed everyday at 5 AM and 7.30 PM.

title: mother of Indian soldier
review: A temple surround by dessert is located at 15km from the line of control between India and Pakisthan. It is said that when Pakisthani army throw bombs when the bomb which fall down in temple was never explode and they are still in temple museum.

title: Sheerm  shreem  Hreem!
review: A bit of a distance , The Guardian of the western front has an amazing history lovingly looked after .A blessing to visit .Kids might not like the drive .an experience for the metaphysically inclined.

title: BSF temple in the desert
review: We had a great 'darshan' of the aarti of Tanot Mata on 17th August 2014. The BSF soldiers were great hosts, and road to the temple from Jaisalmer, through Longewala was awesome that gave a great feel of the Thar desert.

title: Nice and Simple
review: Tanot Mata Temple is situated 120km from Jaisalmer.

title: Worth a ride
review: The best part of this attraction is the journey that leads to this temple. A car drive would be a perfect way to visit. On its way, 50kms from Jaisalmer, one can expect only vast stretches of barren land, sand, shrubs and no sign of human survival. The road travels through the desert with emptiness on both sides, a view uncomparable. The most astonishing thing about this temple is that during 1965 and 1971 Indo-Pak war, there were a number of bombings in this area, but this is the only temple to have survived. This temple was also shown in the movie 'Border', if anyone had seen the movie can recall easily.

title: Tanot
review: It reminds you about the sacrifice made by Indian forces. One should visit laungawala on the way back. Please carry enough water. Try to visit Tanot eearly morning

title: tanot temple must visit
review: tanot mata temple is very famous around jaislmer area. it is 120 k.m. away from jaislmer city. Roads are very god and traffic is null . temple is under army control. there is mini hospital, food court and bank atm is also there.

title: Journey is more important than the destination
review: Someone has truly said that journey is more important than the destination. Get ready and witness the great indian thar desert. Around 125 kms from Jaisalmer, Tanot Mata Mandir seems to be at the end of the earth dotted with small sleepy villages. A well maintained road by Army travels through the 'real' barren and dry thar desert. Take a break at ramgarh to have tea and snacks. Remember after ramgarh their is no mobile network coverage (a bliss) as the place is near pakistan border.

title: Road trip to Tanot Mata Mandir
review: Temple was good and clean. Its maintained by BSF. I enjoyed the driving through the lonely roads of desert. You can see the big sand dunes on the way with few abandoned villages.

title: Good feeling
review: This temple is around 120km from Jaisalmer city but it doesn't take more then 90mts from city as roads are good.

title: Stunning drive through Thar Desert and sand dunes
review: Thrilling drive through sand dunes in the middle of Thar Desert.  Maintained by BSF a war memorial of 2 wars that India fought and won.

title: adventure
review: the road to destination will make you thrill

title: Clean temple and journey to this temple via Ramgarh, Ranau is great.
review: No one to provide any info. Millitary personnel reluctant to interact.

title: Nice Temple
review: Nice Temple & mostly feeling goes with Army as it is maintained by army itself. A must visit place at Jaisalmer.

title: Long drive but worth it
review: It's a long drive to Tanot.  But we loved driving through the desert country side.  Got to see lots of wind mills on the way.  On our way back we cam via Longewala post.  This has the remains of a captured Pakistani tank and truck left behind by the fleeing enemy army during the war of 1971.

title: Realy Holly
review: Middle of desert so nice and beautiful temple with lots of history, Tanot mata temple you realy feel power there and very clean.

title: LONGEST AARTI EVER ATTENDED
review: A beautifully laid out temple with a superb history. The BSF looks after the temple and they have lovely guest rooms which need to be booked at Jaisalmer. The temple is clean and absolutely unlike a great many Hindu temples, courtesy the care showered on it by the BSF. Enroute to the temple make it a point to stop at the Gantiyali Mata Mandir which is about 15 km short of Tanot and pay your respects. Those inclined to attend the aarti either the morning or evening one be cautioned that it is one of the longest ones that I have ever attended.

title: very far from jaisalmer
review: Tanot Tempel very nice but very far from jaisalmer  They took many pictures for us, and wanted us to enjoy the day. We drove by ourself in small cars,

title: Worth
review: Please do visit this . After reaching there you can feel the war between India and Pakistan. The stories of war are fascinating. One should go there to know the history

title: ***must must must visit**
review: real culture and real sand dunes of rajasthan on the way to tanot mata temple will surprise you and if lucky can see some wild life also .............THE TRUST & FAITH OF THIS TEMPLE IS OUTSTANDING ................don't miss it

title: Clean and tidy - Army style
review: The drive to Tanot is through desert and windmills. [Windmills for generating power.] The road is excellent. The temple is maintained by BSF staff; and is thus one of the cleanest Hindu temples I have visited.

title: Really wonderful and charming temple to seek Goddess blessings
review: I was lucky enough to have Darshan of Tanot Mata in first week of January 2014. I with my family went to Rajasthan on week long visit during first week of January 2014 when in Jaisalmer we came to know about great Tanot Mata temple near  Indo Pak  border in Jaisalmer district which is about 120 kilometer from city of Jaisalmer. We all were delighted to see the Temple and interestingly we all were feeling quite fresh even after long road journey. Temple has been maintained in excellent manner and looked very clean and tidy. Surprisingly the visit to temple was like a dream coming true in our life as we had never thought that we will be able to see the beautiful temple in midst of vast desert of hundreds of kilometers where it may not be easy to reach by each and every one. We are of the view that the visit could have been possible with the blessings of great Goddess Tanot Mata. Subhash Lather

title: A must visit..
review: If one needs a feel of thar desert one should go to Tanot mata temple. The place is undoubtedly divine at indo pak border but the road leading to the temple is also awesome. One gets a feel of thar desert with sand dunes streching for miles. The temple is very well maintained by indian army. Overall I enjoyed the journey and the place both..

title: fully treditional
review: very good and treditional temple quite place and lot of qualities covered...people says that it has great image all over the world.

title: Devine Power
review: As told by the local persons there that during india pak war in 1971 pakistan had fired some granades on this temple but they didnt exploded and they are in the display at the temple premises.

title: Worth the Visit!
review: Something about this place. A symbol of faith...Must visit! The desert feel is felt on the way to the place. Worth the money spent on the Taxi!

title: Good Experience
review: They say that during 1971 war, Pakistan Bombed this temple but those bomb did not blast.

title: Heavenly feel !!
review: Jaisalmer trip is incomplet withput visiting Tanot mata temple. Although it is faroff from Jaisalmer(120 Km) towards the Pakistan border, the drive is awesome, riding on straight black road with Desert on the either side. The temple is itself too beautiful, maintained by the BSF folks. its a great feeling to be there.

title: protctive goddess
review: very popular with army and local people . the devi is believe to protect from enemy .

title: Road trip to Tanot is amazing!
review: Road and surroundings to Tanot is worth an experience. Open road with Thar desert and sand dunes!

title: Temple with miraculous history !
review: The temple is around 150- 180 km from the city and is a very famous temple of a goddess.It is an old renowned temple for its history but is now maintained by Army as it has a history linked to both 1965 and 1971 indo Pak war ,  it is said that the area was bombed by more than 400 bombs in 71 war but the temple was unharmed and all soldiers who were in the temple survived.The temple has live bombs and photographs for display.

title: feel the omnipresent
review: Seeing the unexploded shells while all around the temple the area was pock marked with explosions from bombs, neither the artillery burst in and around the temple nor the high calibre gun fire affected it. truly bow our heads to the almighty, and jai mata. The roads are under construction in part which can be dangerous,especially for two wheelers, but overall roads are great and we took less than 2 hours to reach by our self driven car.

title: A temple with a story to tell!
review: I travellled to the Tanot -Mata temple in december 2013 by taxi. We started early morning at 7:15 AM and the ride was truly enjoyable. We saw the sunrise enroute, and in the desert plains, its a beauty! The weather was foggy with visibility dropping to less than 100m at places! It was a beautiful sight of desert and fog. We reached the temple by 90 mins (120km from Jaisalmer). It was a quiet place and I was the only visitor so early in the morning. The deity is highly revered here. Story goes that the deity prevented the destruction by artillery during the 1971 Indo-Pak war. There is a display of the undetonated rockets and bombs found in the area within the temple premises. There is also a BSF guest house, booking for which can be made from any BSF Headquarters. Don't forget to visit the Longewala border on the way back!

title: Amazing Faith
review: We visited the temple after Longewala and it was really worth the visit. The temple complex is neat and clean and there is serenity about the place. The best part is the aarti which is conducted by the priest along with BSF jawans. They have kept unexploded bombs(used during 1971 war) at display and it restores faith. A must visit.

title: Wonderful experience to visit Temple
review: it was really awesome experience. The Road to Tanot is pretty good though at some places it was being repaired by BRO. Suggestion is to visit Tanot First and then go to Longewala. But if you want to visit the International border, please take permission before hand from Jaisalmer or from Ramgarh.

title: Very good temple with few unexploded bombs from 1971 war on display
review: The temple is nicely built and managed by BSF. It has a post frlom where one can take permit to BP609 pillar. Better to carry permission from Ramgarh as sometimes it is difficult to get permits here. The small canteen serves munchies as well.

title: Must go type
review: It will be all together different experience if you go ver here. Border is only 20 km from here. Temple is under the BSF custody.

title: Tanot Mata Temple Visit
review: The journey to the Tanot Mata temple through the desert itself is very nice. The road is excellent, except for a small patch which is being redone.

title: Awesome...Respect Will Make You Kneel Down Before The Almighty
review: One of those places where even someone like me (who doesn't believe in overt worship) would get respectfully numb...one of the most famous mandirs ...one that is the place of great respect for our Jawaans inthe border...the place still holds few Canon-balls that were hurled at this place but didn't blast.....more amazing to me was the fact that the mandir also has a nice worship-place for non-hindus....awesome...

title: Jai Mata Tanot ki( living miracle of Godess)
review: Its 120 km away from jaisalmer , there are pratiroop of mata Tanot i,e, Mata Ghantyali, , Mata Ghantyali is 3 km before Mata Tanot.  in 1965pak troop attacked on Mata  temple on 3 differant occations . First they thought that there is Indian troop on another side and attacked each other on its own pak troop and died in own attack. on second even when pak troop tried to distroy Mata.s murti then all platoon became blind and on third occasion they faught with each other on the point that whether to distry the Devi Mata,s statue or not.

title: Visit to tanot temple and BP 609
review: I with my family ad friends visited this temple and could manage to go up to BP 609. The journey is magnificent and worth. Total distance to and fro is about 380 kilometers so one has to start early in the morning. Till Tanot mata temple you do not need the permission but for the border post, permission is must and it is best if obtained from CO BSF at Ramgarh which comes in the way. The journey to the BP is an experience worth going through a narrow curvy road which is totally deserted.

title: Unbelievable....
review: The god come and save us from the bombs .... Its unbelievable but its true ..that the devi of tanot save lots of people from the bombs ....the bombs are still there to look for the Indians .

title: Very picturesque
review: We went from the Prince Desert Camps and the entire route was very picturesque...the border is just a couple of kms away from the temple...

title: nothing great
review: The place is huge and recently  made n renovated, we were told pakistan bombed the temoke in 1965 war and bombs didnt explode, maybe but unexploded bombs were kept in a enclosure .

title: Incredible....... really a nice trip.
review: The journey from Jaisalmer to Tanot was really nice, a long black ribbon through the endless desert on both side full of thorny bushes and some small wild animals like fox, rabbit etc. On the way don't forget to see the villages, the life out there in the midst of desert. After wading through this desert when you reach Ghante wala mata ki mandir you feel as if it is a miraj. Travel another 3km and you reach Tanot mata ki mandir. Ask the BSF personal there and you will know about the miracles of mata. Overall it was very nice experience to visit the place.

title: 40Kms from the Fort
review: A Long Distance to travel but once their you can enjoy the Temple and its greatness. At a Distance you can also see the India Pakistan Border and the Bullets and Tankers laid in 1971 War.

title: A must vist place when in Jaisalmer......
review: 115 km away from Jaisalmer and ..wow........you will discover yourself in the lap of the desert. A decent welcome by the Indian Army and it is such a sacred place that the enemies could do no harm to it. Pakistan-border is just 10 km away from it. The temple is well-renovated and a calm ambience will welcome you. On the way to the temple, you can see the beauty of the virgin desert....., bushes. In the way You will see the Ghantali Mata temple.

title: Awesome experience
review: Loved the 120 km drive & the feeling of being an Indian. A must visi place for any traveler to jaisalmer.

title: Jai Mata Di!!!
review: The temple is around 100+ km away from Jaisalmer and located near BP609 (India-Pakistan Border). It's a must visit place for someone who believes in God and it's power!!

title: 2 hours drive in Thar Desert
review: Tanot is 120km North West of Jaisalmer in Thar Desert of Rajasthan. It is around 2hrs by car. We took lots of photos of the beautiful vast spread sand dunes with small bushes. This place is very near to Pakistan border. 6km before Tanot is Ghantiyali Mata Temple. You can see the partially damaged Idols of Gods & Goddesses by Pakistani soldiers in 1965 war with India. Tanot Rai Mata Temple is an old temple with a history of India Pakistan war of 1965. Hundreds of shells fallen here did not harm the temple. Some bombs are in display at temple. The temple trust is managed by Border Security Force of India. On the route you can visit Ranua village. Keep food & water with you. The 2 hrs drive is the best way to explore culture, people, food habits, vegetation etc. in the desert.

title: Jai Maa Tanot
review: Have visited twice and will visit again very soon. went with all my friends of Gun Riders Motorcycle Club. (GRMC) The road is accompained both the sides with desert and amazing stretch of straight riding
